review: This Chili's location has seriously stepped up its game.  I used to frequent this location weekly for years since 2009. Over the years the food prices seemed to go up as the quality, atmosphere and service went down. I stopped by this weekend after not having visited all of 2017. I was pleasantly surprised. Despite coming to a busy dining room at 6:30 on a Saturday night we were sat in less than 10 minutes. Our server was prompt and very friendly. Our drinks came very quickly as did our appetizer. Our food was served very hot and the quality far surpasses anything I have gotten from Chili's in the past few years. 2 cocktails, 2 appetizers and 2 entrees resulted in our bill being a modest $62 pre-tip. This Chili's will be back on my list of affordable, quick dining options in the future :)

My mouth tastes like charcoal.   I found $30 worth of Chili's gift cards in my desk, so, since we were out in Concord, decided to have lunch there.   Compliment first.  Our server was excellent.  Knowledgeable, funny, checked in.  Good service, thank you.  But, I ordered crispers, asparagus, and onion rings.  Husband had beef fajitas.  They were ok he says.  Everything on my plate tasted like it had been cooked on a badly washed cast iron griddle.  Charcoal and rancid oil.  The asparagus was not trimmed and was raw.  Still tasted bad.  We gave a full tip of course. Food isn't the servers fault.  Won't be back though.

Chili's was one of my affordable luxuries back in my high school and college days. It was the #1 dinner spot for my friends and I, usually after pickup basketball or a movie. Sadly, changes in people's dining habit and other economic factors have pushed restaurant chains such as Chili's to the brink of irrelevance. I haven't eaten at one for years, but a chance invitation brought me to this chain's Concord location a few weeks ago. After officiating a basketball scrimmage at a nearby school, I was invited by my crew to have a postgame meal here. We walked in at 8:55pm on a Tuesday evening and found the restaurant to be pretty empty. Initially, we were seated at a booth. But since we were so close to the 9:00pm happy hour, we asked to be seated at the bar area instead. After relocating, a male server, whose name I forgot, came by to introduce himself and took our drink order.  Since I didn't see anything that's interesting on the happy hour menu, I decided to do the $22 dinner for two deal with my friend Sarah. She chose the Southwestern Quesadillas and I got the Crispy Chicken Crispers. For appetizer, we got the chips and salsa so that the entire crew could share. Others ordered food off of the happy hour menu. The chips and salsa came first along with our drinks. Our server spotted us sharing the small appetizer and he quickly took it back and exchanged it for a larger size. His nice gesture was appreciated by all of us. Food came soon after. Sarah's quesadillas looked pretty good. My chicken crispers came with five decent size strips of chicken breast, corn on the cob, and fries. The seasoned batter was crispy and the meat was moist and tender. The corn on the cob had a bit of butter on it and was pretty sweet. Fries were very fresh and crispy. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  Service was exceptional. Our server was attentive and showed great hustle taking care of our requests. My crew and I were very satisfied, both with the food and his service. I was glad I had a chance to eat at a Chili's again. Not only it brought back some fond memories of mine, but it also reminded me that chain restaurants do have a place in neighborhoods and can have good food. Although it may not be a frequent occurance, but I will come back again. BONUS MATERIAL: - Large on-site parking lot. Don't leave valuables inside your vehicle. I was told by my Concord counterparts that there were some break-ins recently at that lot. - Major credit cards accepted.
What can you say about Chili's, it's always been a great place to eat. No matter what state your in. No need to tell ya what I ate, I'm a chili's fan!

REVIEW : good food good service chill relaxed place  Food selection : dinner for two for $22 baby back ribs & fries classic bacon burger with fries with a house salad southwest spring rolls strawberry Long Island ice tea watermelon margarita everything was so good ! Ribs fall off the bone burger well done good flavor  Casual place to grab a bite good for watching sports good menu Selections our server was accommodating food came out fast drinks were good makes for a full happy experience chilli's has great burgers! See ya soon!

Food: 5/5.    Price: 5/5.     Service: 3/5.    Ambience: 4/5 Another great visit trying some of their new BBQ items! We had the 3 meat combo and enjoyed all 3 - jalapeño-cheddar smoked sausage, hand-battered chicken crispers(honey chipotle), and half rack of house-smoked baby back ribs($2 extra, Texas dry rub). Everything was served with New roasted street corn, homestyle fries, chile-garlic toast and house-made garlic dill pickles. The chicken crispers and baby back ribs have 4-5 flavors to choose from, and I loved our choices. As for the sides, the roast corn was definitely the best! Of course we ordered my favorite appetizer: Southwestern Eggrolls. A Crispy flour tortillas stuffed with juicy smoked chicken, black beans, corn, jalapeño Jack cheese, chopped red peppers & spinach. Served with avocado-ranch sauce. It is super special and I've never had anything like this at other restaurants, definitely a must every time!   Three For Me deal was another steal, with just $10! Start off with either a house salad or tostada chips & salsa. Next, choose your fajitas: Chicken or Carnitas. Finish with a delicious Mini Molten Cake. The fajitas was about 1/2 of the original size, but it's a great combo anyway. After 5+ visits, here is my compacted list of my favorites in Chili's menus: Favorites: * Southwestern Eggrolls ($8.99)  *Triple dipper ($11.99) - southwestern egg rolls, crispy cheddar bites, spiced Pablo onion rings  * Ultimate Smokehouse Combo ($17.99+2) - 3 meats: jalapeño-cheddar smoked sausage, hand-battered chicken crispers,  half rack of house-smoked baby back ribs (add 2.00). Served with New roasted street corn, homestyle fries, chile-garlic toast and house-made garlic dill pickles. * Three For Me ($10) - House salad +Carnitas fajitas + Mini Molten Cake * Fajitas ($12.99) - carnitas & prime rib (+ $1.50). Sizzling fajitas served with bell peppers & caramelized onions, topped with chipotle garlic butter and chopped cilantro  * fresh mex pairings ($9.99) - beef enchilada, green chile chicken enchilada, chicken quesadilla. Served with citrus chile rice and black beans.  * Lunch Double Burger ($8) * Lunch pork carnitas fajitas ($8) * Lunch combo sides - southwest chicken soup, fresco salad,  house salad * Chips and Salsa ($3.39)  * Triple berry margarita($8.99) - Sauza Blue Tequila & Chambord Black Raspberry Liqueur with blackberries and blueberries, shaken with fresh sour & fresh strawberry purée Others: * Lunch Southwestern BLT Toasted Sandwich ($6)

Menu Selection - Very good Ambience - Good Service - Good Technology - Tablet at the table Parking - Plentiful, easy Access - Single point This particular Chili's has been around a long time. To their credit, it's been properly maintained, nicely updated and renovated. There's a separate sports bar with stools, lots of TVs, a couple of bistro tables and booths. The dining areas are divided up, which really helps with ambient noise, and reduces the feeling of crowdedness especially when it's busy. The innovative menu seems to have something for every budget and taste preference - burgers, TexMex/Southwest and lots of other interesting fare. The beef, chicken enchiladas I tried was really tasty, with cilantro Spanish rice, pico de gallo salsa, black beans cooked just right and not mushy. Price was very attractive and reasonable right at around $10 per order. I was hungry, and the portion was perfect. Went there around 8p on purpose because I prefer it peaceful and quiet, less chance of wildlings (bratty kids). Place is open til 11p, wow! Definitely on my list of late-nite haunts. I used the tablet to pay, and it was so cool. In a few short years, all restaurants will be thus equipped.

I decided to show my girlfriend chili's for the first time over the weekend and it was a disappointment. We ordered the new chips con queso which had quac and white cheese which wasn't good at all and the chips were so salty. I should have just stuck with the normal con queso but since it was on the happy hour menu figured I would give it a go - big mistake. The server was nice but wasn't really clear on the happy hour menu items. I wanted to get the honey chicken crispers but then when the food came out I got boneless buffalo wings. I asked the server to take the boneless wings back and I wanted the crispers instead.  We also ordered the combo fajitas with chicken, steak, and shrimp and again the food was too salty. The shrimp was very small and the steak was way too tough. The chicken was supposed to be grilled but didn't look like it at all. Then the crispers comes out and guess what? No honey sauce on it, just the crispers. The waiter tells the person that we ordered honey and to take it back. My girlfriend really likes corn on the cob but chili's still somehow managed to mess that up as well. This is CORN ON THE COB - either you boil it or just toss it on the grill. There was one part of the corn where there was salt/paprika and just ruined the taste. I have been to chilis a number of times but I can't see myself going back anymore. I have never had food so salty like that ever. There are plenty of other restaurants to check out nearby in the area but the quality of the food has really gone down hill. I would recommend avoiding this place at all costs and your money could be better used elsewhere!

This is our weekly/monthly hang out. Kids love the Lava Cake, mommy loves the Margaritas, daddy enjoys the Cajun chicken pasta, my 2yo likes the chips..it's a win-win situation for all. They have healthy options like sirloin with asparagus. A 3 course meal with drinks for a family of 5 is only $50! That's a great value if you can share meals and you all have the small tastes in food.  Today, my daughter forgot her purse hanging on the chair. I called and they were able to save it for us to pick up. Thank goodness we didn't lose the rose gold Coach purse I gave her for her 10th bday. (sad, it's too soon to pass on my collection)lol
Came in for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised at how great our service was. Ask for Michael and he will take excellent care of you.

I can't believe I hadn't updated my review sooner. Since that poor experience several years ago, we have become regulars at this location, in large part due to the awesome bartenders. Stephanie and Sabrina are some of the best in Concord. I highly recommend sitting up at the bar if you come in here because their service is worth it.

My most recent visit to this restaurant has deemed this place my least favorite of all the Chili's chains in the bay area. The service is seriously lacking when you aren't sitting at the bar. Went for date night with the hubby and had the two for 35$ deal. That includes margaritas with dinner. The drinks tasted like pure margarita mix. I even opted for the upgrade on the tequila, getting patron instead of the presidential. But I didn't taste anything but Margarita mix. We both ordered steak, I upgraded the mac and cheese. My steak was overdone. I ordered it medium well and it came well done. My mac and cheese was just cold noodles with hot cheese sauce on top. I didn't mention the steak because I didn't want to wait another 20 minutes for them to prep a new one. But i did mention the mac and cheese. Our server took my mac and cheese and came back 5 minutes later. She microwaved my dish. I could instantly tell because the dish was blazing hot. same little bite was taken out of the side.  I'm so disappointed. This location is close to my house but honestly I just don't want to chance coming back here again.
Food was fair but noise was so loud we couldn't talk to each other over dinner.  Not a place to go for dinner and conversation.

I usually come here for the deals and the lava cakes, it's a pretty nice place and service tends to be good. Today my girlfriend and I ordered a lava cake as usual. Midway through the meal, I felt a hair or something in my mouth, spat it out, and there I see something that was actually a dental floss looking material! Appetite being killed, we didn't accept the complementary desert, so we instead  asked if we could get an appetizer and they gladly allowed it. Our waiter Luke was very nice and accommodating despite the place being packed and busy. He handled the situation well since his manager was too busy to address our dilemma. Now yelp wants me to put mustard on this review, so I will continue and say that this chili's gets a higher review because of my own bias with it being in close proximity to me. There's your mustard Yelp.
I recommend this restaurant for large groups. There were 5 of us and we didn't wait long. Our server was great michael took good care of us he was very patient, took time to explain the menu to us

I think that this Chili's location rocks. I've had nothing but positive experiences here. The food has always been great, the cocktails are consistently strong and delicious, and the service has been dynamite every single time. I highly recommend this spot as a great and affordable place to grab a meal on any night out.

It's Chili's. What were you expecting? A lot of maligned reviews on here. If you want fine dining or authentic Mexican you're in the wrong place... and you must have been living under a rock all this time for not knowing... also dumb for posting a review online about it.

Chili's is usually one of our favorite spots, but tonight wasn't a good visit because of the service from Jeffrey K. He took forever with our skillet queso and it was the wrong one when it finally showed up. So we had to wait forever again to get the right one, and he was really slow with refilling our drinks.

When my best friend and I came by for lunch the other day I have to admit I had a few reservations. I've had many people very recently tell me how horrible this Chile's was, plus all the not so positive reviews on Yelp. However our experience at Chile's was actually pretty amazing. We were seated in the bar area which was packed and our server was Giovanni. On each table they have tablets where you can order and pay for your food, as well as play games. I'm not a fan of these things so I just moved it to another table.   We both had drinks; a tall 22 oz. glass of Sam Adams summer brew for me, and a very strong Long Island ice tea for my friend. My beer was very refreshing, but the Long Island ice tea had us both a little wobbly by the time we left.  They do a "Dinner for two" deal for $20.00 that was just perfect for us. You get your pick of one appetizer, plus two entrees, and the list for both is not bad. We ordered the chips and salsa for our appetizer which is endless, and I ordered the BBQ bacon burger for my entrée.  The chips and salsa come in massive quantity, but after having amazing chips and salsa the night before this batch was a little underwhelming. The chips are incredibly thin and the salsa was very watery. Both had pretty good taste to them, but when you're used to homemade nothing else really compares.  My burger was fantastic though. The size was somewhere between a slider and a giant burger, which was perfect. Everything about it was amazing; the patty had great flavor, the cheese elevated it, the BBQ sauce was rich and just enough to cover the burger but not make a huge mess, and even the bun tasted awesome. The burger comes with fries which tasted like they were made fresh in the restaurant. They tasted like actual potato, and they were perfectly salted. The burger also comes with a small cup of their homemade pickles that are AMAZING!! They are combined with big chunks of garlic, and are just out of this world. Once I was finished with the cup I asked for a larger cup which they happily obliged.  Even though we were both stuffed, and slightly drunk we ordered dessert anyways. The molten lava brownie is what jumped out at me. A giant brownie atop chocolate sauce, with a big scoop of vanilla ice cream on top of that, plus the ice cream was covered in hard chocolate shell. This dessert is a shock to your taste buds in the best possible way. It's both hot and cold, with different textures, different flavors, and just a masterpiece. It's possible we caught them on a great day, but even if that's the case I would recommend trying Chile's, or for those who have, give them another shot.
This place is absolutely horrid. The manager is an a**hole. He continued to cut us off when tried speaking, I've never felt so attacked, never will come to this location again.

Wow. Still as bad as I remembered it.  So why go back again?  My wife had a craving for fajitas so went there on a Sunday afternoon.    I had almost forgotten how bad the food was last time, and today's visit was yet another painful reminder.   This is to note the service was indeed decent.  We were welcomed with a smile at the door, and both of our servers were friendly and helpful.   But it's the food.  The food was/is truly subpar.   I remember when it was Sizzler's if you were on a budget and E-Bar / Chillies if you felt like balling out. The prices there are reasonable/questionable.  $18.00 for a big ribeye cut, while its at least $30 everywhere else.  Yea!  Questionable to say the least

I was tempted to give them one star.  There is nothing wrong with them per se, except I'd wish they wouldn't include french fries with most of the sandwiches and many other entre items.  However, they made a horrendous faux pas when I was in there last week.  A friend of mine decided to do a two-for lunch of sirloin steak.  I ordered medium rare and my companion ordered medium.  My steak arrived "well done" while my companion received one that was "tartare" style -- only seared and raw in the middle.  This was totally unacceptable.  If it wasn't for the time factor (my companion had a meeting) we would have returned the steaks.  At least the well done was edible.  We decided to just pay the bill and leave.

Worst Chili's ever! the Bloody Marys are disgusting, the food takes forever, and to top it off the place was not very packed and it took us about 15 minutes to get us a table for 4. I will not be back to this chili's

Gave this place another try, only because I had a gift card. The service was good, our waiter was nice but the food, meh. I got the Chipotle Chicken Fresh Mex Bowl. the rice seemed hard/dry and the lettuce had a bitter/off taste. Such a bummer because it looked pretty good but the taste was definitely lacking.

Ahhh....the first review of 2016 and my hopes of getting "Elite" for a full fiscal year....here we go, lets get this review rolling, after the many times I've been here, it's now time to review my experience here as a critic of sorts, that is what we do on Yelp right? Lol let's go for this little ride.. I want my baby back, baby back, baby back, baby back. I want my Chili's, baby back ribs, bbq sauce! Although I didn't eat any on this trip here, I did happen to enjoy my Wings over Buffalo, I opted for the smoky chipotle honey flavor. The wings weren't flashed friend enough for my liking but, the sweet and smokey sauce totally made up for it, was it worth the ($9.99) price tag? I'm still on the fence about that, but I enjoyed them, I totally cleared them off my plate. The staff here could pay more attention to the customer and make sure drinks are tended too, being that's what a bartender does, and making sure our appetizer and food orders are taken in a timely mannor. But sometimes it is what it is and in this case the staff couldn't blame it on NYE festivities, it was around 7:30 p.m. December 31, 2015 last year, soooooo....the place want uber packed yet and myself and my entourage (yea just like the tv show) were the only ones at the bar.  From what my friends had 11oz Steak ($11.99 a piece) they said both of their steaks and sides were made exactly to their liking, my other buddyl had the chicken quesadilla that he said was pretty bomb. We all cleared our plates. Could of been the Gin and Tonics and Beers we had leading up go our food, either way it was a decent overall experience at this Chili's location. This location is located off Concord Ave right next to the Premere Inn, with Shell Gasoline being right across the street and Highway 680 being literally right next to the Chili's. In my closing, everyone shouldn't be too new to a Chili's by now, but if you are. The menu option have something for the most seasoned to the newest restaurant, bar person. I know they make awesome margaritas and the star baby back ribs and chicken crispers are the bomb! The have a nice happy hour here..although I missed it go tonight..but all in due time. If you happen to be in the Concord area, check this place out on your own and Yelp review your own experience. And Happy New Year!

At least once a month my friends and I dine at Chili's. Tonight we decided to sit in the bar area for Sunday happy hour and had server Jessica. She clearly had friends dining in the bar area because they seemed way more important than the rest of the tables she had, her job! Her tables, including us, were constantly looking around for Jessica and waiting on something. My friends and I were very disappointed with the service we received. Next time we will consider sitting in the regular dining area or not coming back at all.  Also, an employee that seemed to be off the clock was sitting in he bar area with her friends enjoying happy hour. She was drinking and swearing loudly, making her literally the loudest person in the bar area. Both servers made Chili's look very unprofessional.  Don't get me wrong, drinking and swearing loudly is fun, but not when your wearing your work shirt and running to the back for sauce, you should be representing the company you work for a little better than that.

Decided to try the To Go option for lunch. I ordered the Guacamole, Chips and Salsa. It came with an enormous bag of chips. I had the Southwestern Egg Rolls. Probably not a good to go item. They were a bit soggy, but still tasty. Boneless Buffalo wings were good. The only complaint is that there weren't any utensils or napkins in the bag. Otherwise they had our order ready on time and the staff smiled and were very polite.

Ehh... it's ok. Nothing special. I'll only probably come for the ribs. The big mouth bites were good, but the boneless chicken taste like frozen dinner food, and I was just not into the cheddar bites. Overall, service was great!

I really want to give this place -5 star. Atmosphere is ghetto, lots of traffic from the shady hotel nearby. Mashed potatoes were from a box...disgusting! Don't bother looking at the menu, your food will arrive subpar! Water is cloudy and the guacamole came from a can, nothing real or good about it. Kids pizza was burnt and had little to no cheese. I'll never be back!

Visited this place couple weeks ago and did a take out, but when I got to the take out counter  few minutes before the promised time, the food was already there and was cold....Have dined in last year for a birthday and nothing special. Your typical franchise resto.

How is it humanly possible that this particular Chili's location has such AWESOME servers!?!?! Marisa (?) is one of the BEST servers for ANY restaurant - genuinely courteous & does a tremendous job of checking in / making sure everything is to our liking. The only that could have better is the cleanliness of this restaurant.  Multiple tables were not bused & floors were dirty with food & trash - really not acceptable with a half empty restaurant & a full staff.

First time eating at Chili's and we waited a really long time to get our food. Usually I wouldn't complain, but it was ridiculous. We went on a Friday, so maybe that's why it's so busy, but even then it was too long. I guess someone dipped without paying, so most of the workers were trying to figure out who the person was by viewing the security tapes. I enjoyed my food though. I think I had the combo where I could choose 3 items. Since we waited so long for our food, our waiter gave us a free dessert. It was really thoughtful and tasted great! It was like a pizzookie (: I enjoyed the loaded potato soup so delicious!

Server showed up at the table, not much personality, too busy playing with her pony tail, as we're the other waitresses. Pasta dishes were dry, empty plates sat on the table for long time....won't be coming back.

Not going to lie we walked in like an hour in a half before closing.  The whole time we were there we got nothing but two blond female workers doing nothing but saying "I WANT TO GO HOME." I understand being tired and wanting to go home we have all been there at some time in our life.  But honestly you took this job knowing the hours. If your that tierd get a 9-5 job!  No matter what kind of job you have you should always remain professional. Not to mention they started cleaning the seats while we were eating and food was flying everywhere.  Management please go over the way your emplyees should act to your customers.

I came here after work with a coworker and the manager that sat us was one of the rudest people I have ever met. I have never felt so unwelcome in a restaurant before in my life and I will not returning to Chilli's in Concord. It makes me question how people like him are able to successfully manage a business.

I've  came to this location a handful of times and I usually get the steak and shrimp fajitas. During the week this place isn't very packed but today it was. But the wait was only about 10 mins so it wasn't that bad.  I started off with the asparagus appetizer it's new on the menu and they were bomb!! They come fried with some great season on it. Tito's punch a new alcoholic beverage with vodka and rum in it, definitely good drink. They have a prime rib fajitas and a trio I ended up getting the prime rib and shrimp fajitas and let's just say I'd ordere them again they had so much flavor. I hope they keep the prime rib on the menu since it's new. I have to admit our waiter Kyle was really good he got to us right away brought out my fajitas hot and fresh. So the 4 stars is because our waiter and the cook came through thus visit. I'll be back!
Your typical Chili's...the location is kind of sketchy being near motels.  Nothing special here...same food like all others.
We haven't been to a chilis for a very longtime , and the service was excellent.The waitress suggested items on the menu they were great.I would definitely recommend this Chilis

I love Chili's and used to be a regular, I'd come every Thursday night after class with some friends and just eat and talk over food.  A few hours ago my coworkers and I had a little dinner to say goodbye to someone who would no longer be working with us. Upon being seated, we are greeted by our server, Ronnie, who was very cute, attentive and upbeat. She took our orders and the food came out eventually, it was somewhat busy so I do understand the small delay.  I had a triple order of shrimp fajitas, and they were amazing, I highly recommend them.  So far, it sounds like my experience was great, but things take a turn for the worse, thus granting this rating to be 3 Stars. Most probably in an attempt to maintain the upbeat persona, our server, Ronnie, began some small talk, which was fine, until she came to check in on us a few minutes after our food had been served. Upon seeing my fajita skillet (which once held three orders of shrimp) empty, she exclaimed "WOW. Good job." I was slightly offended, considering she is a very, slender girl and I'm just not a fan of having people comment on my dietary habits, especially if there's an implication that I'm eating more than I should. Should she have been a bigger girl, it would have been more acceptable and I would have felt some sense of camaraderie, however, since she's not, i just took offense.  Things escalate very quickly once dessert arrives. Upon serving, she  misgenders me, and calls me "princess" when clearly I am male. I make it very clear that that is not okay and she explains that she overheard one of my coworkers calling me that. Yes, a coworker, someone whom I have formed a bond with over the years and have gotten to know and be comfortable around and mess around with, not some stranger whom I had just met thirty minutes ago. She did feel bad for her mistake (although I don't recall an actual apology), and didn't charge me for my dessert. I still tipped her very well, around ~40%, considering her services were great, and I did feel bad that she felt bad, however discounting a part of a meal does not wipe away the mistakes that were made, which is why I'm still writing this review.

I tried this location with my boyfriend 6 years ago now. We were teenagers who couldn't really afford to dine out anywhere except here because of their Two for $20 deal. Now its 6 years later and we are still frequent visitors. Why? Well the variety they have is great not to mention the delicious margaritas. I definitely recommend the Texas Cheese Fries which are french fries in a skillet with cheese, onions, and jalapeños FANTASTIC. So for the service has always been quick and friendly. What more can I ask for?
Alright place for american mexican. I remember they had more choices.
Friendly service at Concord location. Molten is my fav.! Fajita and shrimp tacos . A good place to eat.

No one there to greet us when we walked in. We were waved over to a side of the restaurant and told to pick a table. We waited 5 min to be greeted by the waiter. We ordered our beverages and our appetizers (loaded white queso & honey chipotle wings) and things seem to be ok. We browsed the menu and decided on our selections. The waiter came back with chips and salsa since we knew the queso woukd take a little while. Things were looking up. Our appetizers came. Wings were good, but our queso was missing the meat. Our waiter was no where to be found. Finally flagged down a different waiter and she took the queso away. House salad was warm, very little dressing. Still no waiter to be found. 25 minutes later my husband's salad Finally arrived, along with the queso which we'd been waiting for. At that point we didn't even want it. Our drinks were empty, our waiter was missing and he had taken the convenient mini-computer we could pay on. And so we waited. And waited. And waited. After all that we were charged for the queso. Terrible service, ok food, but terrible experience overall. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

I've been to different Chili's locations several times before but this is my first time at this specific location. This is also my first time absolutely loving every single thing we ordered in any Chili's before. My boyfriend and I came in for an early dinner on a Monday night. We ended up doing the $35 dinner for two. This comes with two margaritas, an appetizer, two entrees, and a dessert (such a great deal). For our drinks, I got a classic strawberry margarita (additional $0.50) and my boyfriend got the platinum Presidente margarita (additional $2). I absolutely LOVED both drinks. Best margaritas I've had in a while. Most of the time, when I get margaritas, they are either too watery or it seems like it's just straight up alcohol. Our drinks today were so perfectly made. For appetizer, we got the guac and chips, which were amazing as well. For entree, my boyfriend got the classic bacon burger and I got the cajun chicken pasta. The pasta was soooo good! The alfredo sauce was perfect (not bland and very creamy). And for dessert, we got the skillet toffee fudge brownie. By the time we got to dessert, I was pretty buzzed already yet I could still clearly remember how amazing this dessert tasted. Overall, a very great experience. Something that I honestly thought would be hard to expect from any Chili's. Also, great customer service. Thanks Gabe!

When we ordered the $35 for 2 deal, the waitress (Angel according to the receipt) did not advise us that there would be a $1 substitution surcharge per entree. We come to Chili's probably 3-5 times a year. During each of the times we came before, we always got the $35 for 2 drinks, a shared app, 2 entrees and shared desert. The waitress always advised us before that the mac and cheese substitution was a $1 surcharge, but we were advised there was no surcharge for other substitutions. And, looking at bills, my mother had never been charged to substitute onion rings for fries before. After we had already ordered, people sat at the booth next to ours. I specifically remember the waitress saying something about baked beans being $1 extra and she told them she would do some favor to fix their meal for them, not to worry, she'd take care off it. I didn't think too much of it as I assumed she would extend the same courtesy for us if there was a surcharge that would be tacked on to our meal.  First, the waitress brought the wrong food. Then some guy delivered our desert to another table. When it finally made it to our table, already melting, the guy dumped it on the table with 4 spoons. I guess because I'm fat the guy suggested we share with other people, smirking with a tone.  When we received the bill there was a $1 substitution charge for each dish. Mine was expected, my mother's was not. When my mom asked the waitress about it, she got hateful--with a senior citizen--saying that it was printed in the menu so, essentially it was my mother's tough luck if she didn't catch the fine print. Angel got very belligerent, getting a menu and jabbing her finger at the menu in a triumphant tone, like sneaking a $1 surcharge past a senior citizen was some kind of victory. I think taking advantage of senior citizen on a fixed income sounds more like elder abuse. Why would any server try to hide a $1 surcharge and then essentially say ha, ha, jokes on you when the bill comes out? Her deception cost her $1.40 off her tip and we will never go back. To add to Angela's shady activities, as we were leaving, she was leaning into the same booth next to our, the same people she said she would take care of, letting them know she deducted $5 off their bill.  I wonder how many other people were cheated by Angel so that she could give her friends a $5 deduction from their bill tonight.
..ordered 6ounnce sirloin.. Very unhappy..more than half was grisly.. On other hand service was great..
Went out with my wife and friends and the service and food was awesome! To top things off, we didn't even have to ask the waiter for the check, we just paid at the table with the Ziosk hardware.
Great service.  Way better than Applebee's.  The waitresses/waiters are all attentive to their tables.  Kind and friendly environment.  Hardly a long wait for a table.
I don't think I would give this place one star if a half star was available. They at least brought out food fit for possibly farm animals.  Absolutely horrible. No repeat customers here

Always great service with a friendly staff. My orders are usually placed togo and I've never had any errors.    I'm in love with the create your own combo, steak and salmon for me.  The burgers are good as well. Check out the bacon and BBQ burger with cheddar cheese.  Thanks again for awesome customer service!!!

I haven't been a to a Chili's in years but we were in Walnut Creek for a high school football game so decided why not.  The place was packed and there was a 15 minute wait but a table in the bar area became available so we decided to sit there.  Our waitress was very friendly and they changed one of the games to the Notre Dame football game which was perfect.  My wife and I ordered burgers.  She got the guacamole turkey burger and I had the new sweet and savory burger.  Both were good and tasty and the fries that came along with it were the same. One of the coolest parts was their new Ziosk where you can read the news, play games and paid your bill (which we did).

Service was the star today and this featured our server Chris. Great young man, attentive with a smile each visit to our table. Chips and salsa were excellent, Buffalo Chicken Salad was big and favorable. Wife had soup and salad and enjoyed. The salad was a house with vinaigrette and for soup she picked chicken enchilada.  Great experience thanks to a wonderful server named Chris.

Ordered $20 for 2. She had the Ribs, was ok. I had the steak, wish I had ordered the ribs, steak was tough on almost every peice I bit into. Well never order that again ! Service was friendly and good. A bit noisy, but that is to be expected at a place like this.
Terrible service and can y'all explain to me how you run out of chips at 6pm? This makes no sense!
Food was great and since we called in ahead  we had a table as soon as we arrived! We love coming here for date night. Our server Brandon was great.

I imagine the Chili's in Walnut Creek only closed their doors due to outrageous rent prices. They were always busy, so I was not surprised that on a Sunday afternoon, Chili's Concord was busy as well. It's been years since WC closed and I think Ive only been to Concord one time other than today. We stopped in for margaritas, but both ended up ordering food as well. My husband had a Southern Smokehouse burger. It came with fries (lucky for him they were thick cut so I didn't steal very many). The $10.49 burger was cooked great but he was upset about all the pickles and lettuce that came on it (which I was happy to take all of).  I had eaten not long before, so I requested a custom order of fried jalapenos.  Their onion strings come with jalapenos, so I requested the onion strings, without the strings.  I received a small cup of perfectly cooked and fried pieces for $1.79.  Casey surprised me by ordering an infused (pomegranate/blueberry margarita) $8.99.  I stuck with what I know, the Presidente ($7.59 if youre okay with well tequila). It has brandy in it as well, be warned! I love these and think they're a great deal. Plus, the infused one was much too sweet - mine was perfect. Our server, Knecht, was awesome. Very friendly and attentive and happy to accommodate my weird food request and even ask the kitchen some questions on behalf of my husband.  She promptly brought our check and cleared our plates.  The woman who took our drink order when we sat (bartender, most likely?) made my day by IDing me.   We also saw her again working hard clearing plates at other tables. Great team work.  Glad we stopped in today!

I have never dined in at this location, so this review is for the to-go service only. I would give zero stars if that was an option. I called tonight and ordered the $20 for 2 dinner. The guy I spoke with said it would be ready in 10-15 minutes. Alright, cool. I was running late and didn't show up until 7:50 (25 minutes after I hung up the phone after ordering). I paid for my meal and the girl at the register said it would be a few minutes while the bagged it up. 15 minutes passed before I had to approach a staff member to ask where the hell my food was. Turns out it had been sitting on the counter the entire time I was waiting, meaning my food was barely warm by the time I got it.

I recently went here to come and eat on a Tuesday evening and it was pretty packed but we did get seated right away. The location of this Chili's is kinda of random it's near a motel and also near the Mount Diablo high school. Service here is pretty good but idk it depends on how crowded it is. Our waitress was good on maintaining our food and drinks and she was very nice.  The restaurant it's self is ok/good on cleanliness I did see some sticky spots on the ground and also some of the booths were still filled with crumbs which was sort of disgusting.. But the good thing is that the bathrooms were well kept and clean.   This Chili's does have a "Chili's To Go stand inside the restaurant (it's right in the corner) and we were seated couple seats down where it was and I was surprised on how many people showed up to pick up there food and leave. There was a line (just like 2 or 3 people) but other than that there wasn't any slow service or like a line out the door so it wasn't that crazy.  Last but not least, the food and appetizers were well made and were good. I only gave it 4 stars because the restaurant wasn't cleaned that well and for a restaurant or even a Chili's like that that's sort of sad. :/ OTHER: Parking space is pretty huge so don't worry about parking and also try the California flatbread for appetizers.

Ordered food  to go with their app and scheduled time for pick-up. When I arrived my food was not cooked. The cashier never apologized. He then put the order in but I had to wait an additional 15 min. Then to top it off, they got it wrong.  Thank you Chili's for getting my order wrong and wasting my lunch time.

Don't sit at the bar unless you order alcohol otherwise the blonde bartender will be a real bitch to you.  I came in after a long day of running errands and just wanted to sit at the bar, watch some tv and grab some dinner. When I told her all I wanted was a Dr. Pepper she was PISSED!!! She actually started helping some people at the other end of the bar that sat down after me before she even gave me a menu or my drink. I sat there waiting for about 10 minutes and almost walked out but she eventually gave me my drink.  I ordered the 10 piece boneless buffalo wings and it only came out with 9. I wasn't going to make a stink about one missing wing, especially not to this girl, but she ignored me the entire time I ate and didn't pay any attention to me or see if I was doing OK. She finally came by and laid the check down. I just threw down some cash and walked out. I didn't want to have to sit there forever waiting on her or deal with her crappy attitude.  I've never gotten bad service sitting at one of the high top tables and I would have sat at one of them but it was extremely packed and all that was left was the one end chair at the bar so I took it. Next time I will just not sit at the bar again. As a former bartender, take my advice blondie. Don't be a bitch to paying customers. You work off tips. Looks aren't everything. You are cute but you are replaceable and Brinker International would be pissed to know they hired a bartender with a bad attitude.

If there was a no star review I would give it.  Website says they deliver....and they don't anymore...fine I will pick it up.  First fail!  Asked for loaded potato skins...listed on the website...sorry ma'am we don't carry those anymore.  Okay...bye bye, done with Chili's, 2 strikes, YOUR OUT!!

My Family & I have been eating at this restaurant for over 6 years now. We Love it we eat dinner at this location all the time and we also have birthday celebrations here and I have to say the staff is Amazing and the restaurant manager is Amazingly Awesome his name is Dan. The service is exceptional every time. The servers are always attentive and checking in, asking if everything is ok, if we need a refill and sometimes they just take the cup and bring it filled, they are sweet and courteous. Some of the servers know who we are just because we always go eat a little after 8pm my husband and I and our 2 kids. And sometimes they are like your not having dessert tonight. And Dan we always have funny conversations with him and my daughter she's a very shy girl but not around Dan she talks to him and it's nice to come to a restaurant where you can say this is our restaurant where we have been coming for years now and will continue to go to because it's family friendly and the management and staff are super Amazing, Friendly, Courteous, and I recommend chili's in concord to all of my customers, family, and friends. Dan has probably by now has meet our best friends and my family because we bring everyone with us to eat dinner at chili's. And I have to say I love love love the sirloin with double loaded mash potatoes omg I can taste it as I'm writing about it. I don't know how they prepare it but omg it's to die for it so so tasty juicy and good I once had two steaks because I couldn't get over how good juicy and tasty it is.  But anyone who reads this review go to chili's you will not be  disappointed.  Thanks For Reading!

I brought my sister here today and was very disappointed in the experience today. We did the 2 for $20 dinner and ordered the half order of Texas Cheese fries. The order was burnt and dried out and the cheese was crusty and tasteless. We then ordered two grilled chicken salads with thousand island and of course they no longer have thousand island but it's a Special sauce. So we both ordered the "sauce" and it came it was spicy and chipotle-ish, she could have warned us. Anyway not impressed, it was pretty dead for a Wed dinner. Will not be back.

Good Food, Good Drinks, and Good Service. What a great way to enjoy lunch on a Sunday; burgers, fries, a drink, and sports. I ordered the Southern Smokehouse Burger that was cooked perfectly and had shoestring onion rings on top of the patty and it was really good.  The onion rings were crispy but not to overpowering.  The burger came with fries which were also crunchy done right. To start off the meal I ordered a pomegranate/blueberry margarita which had a little too much mix and not enough tequila for as big of a glass that it came in but it was still good and did the job.   The service was great, our server Knecht, was very friendly and did an excellent job.

I typically have nothing but good experiences at this Chili's, but my visit this evening left a bad taste in my mouth. I came in a group of four, and we all had separate checks. The food was good, and despite our waitress barely stopping by our table, we were happy with the service because of how nice she was. We left a generous tip because we had a fairly good experience. However, one of our checks wasn't paid because the machine had an error reading a card. It was not made clear that the bill had not been paid, and we all had receipts, so we assumed we were all good to go. When we began to leave the restaurant, our waitress stopped us to tell us that one of the checks had not been paid, and began to treat us very rudely. It was clear that we were not trying to dine and dash, as 3/4 of our bills were paid & we left a tip almost equivalent to the price of the unpaid meal. However, the waitress quickly snatched the tip we left, and her demeanor completely changed, and she began to treat us as if we were high schoolers trying to steal a meal. It was a simple mistake caused by THEIR card reader, and I really did not appreciate how negatively we were treated, when the situation could have been calmly resolved. I don't think I will be returning soon as our server made us feel very unwelcome.

Back in what I like to call, the day, my husband and I would come here on Sundays to sit in the bar and have a lovely lunch for ourselves. Now with small children we are forced to sit in the regular ham & egger section.  It's a totally horrible different world in there.  I don't recommend it to families. So we were sat in a booth by the hostess then pretty much ignored for a long time.  To count at least 3 people came over to ask for our drinks.  Still not sure who the waitress was. I usually bring a few things for my son to munch on or drink before we get food to keep him occupied.  We didn't have silverware and we didn't have napkins.  We still didn't have those things up until our apps and food came.  I had to get up and get our own from the server area.   We ordered a Cheeseburger for our son and it was the worst food Ive ever been served.  I honestly think that it was a day old burger that had been sitting out and then they put it in the microwave for 10 seconds.  It was horrifyingly bad.  I wouldn't have served my dog that burger. Then I always order the Chicken Enchilada Soup.  It was also filmy and seemed to have been sitting out before it was served to me. I have vowed to not come back.  There are a thousand nicer restaurants with better food and drinks that accept children and feed them great food.  They should be ashamed.

Ok, it should be 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't allow partials. Its the standard ol'semi-fast food, no differentiation in flavor edible items. Went with the Boneless Buffalo Chicken Salad and had it once before. The first time, about a 9 months ago, seemed much better. This time, it was bland and needed extra buffalo sauce. The Mrs. had the Santa Fe Salad and was bored with it after 3 bites. The spicy 'sauce' was in the middle of the dish and not throughout so depressing. Our daughter had the Ribeye and it was done just right, maybe even alittle light of medium rare. Swapped out the broccoli for their new mashed potatoes and she was happy. Her other side was some southwestern mac & cheese and we'll not be ordering that again. Being able to pay at the table on the Ziosk was cool. We've done it now 2-3 times and it seems to work. It would be very nice if the games on the Ziosk were free during the meals - or free if you ordered $X of food or drink. Come on, how much money does that generate anyway? It was nice of them to disclose that the auto-tip calculator is using the "AFTER TAX" amount to generate the tip. Thus, with 8% tax, you're adding a tip on top of that so do the math in your head and adjust. We left 14% by the machine tally but were actually over 16% in reality when you base the tip $$ on the food/beverage cost. I don't want to tip based on the tax amount - who does that anyway! Another easy fix for Chili's to make if they want folks to keep using the Ziosk. The chocolate brownie/cookie ice cream thing for desert was very good when warm and we split it across three people - still a lot of desert but a nice finishing touch. Overall, we'll likely be back but will not get the same dishes. Back to the burger and fries!

Super friendly staff and the bar tenders Jessica and angel are fantastic! First time ever eating a chilis and will definitely come back soon. The food came out much sooner than expected even though they were super busy. I really enjoyed my experience at this location.

After how they treated that veteran at the Chili's in Texas, they can kiss my ass.  I will NEVER give them another penny of my money, and if you have an ounce of integrity and human compassion, you won't either.
Came here for lunch today with my mom. Very good food and service. I totally forget my server's name, but she was really sweet. Enjoyed our lunch, drinks and conversation. It was a good experience!

Their Mango Chile Chicken is WAY TOO SPICY!!! Be forewarned, it will put your mouth on fire and make your stomach sick for the night. Their chips and guacamole. Wow what a let down. The chips were so salty if you dunked them in an aquarium you could turn a fresh water tank into a salt water tank instantly. The guacamole was worse than store bought. I'd prefer Trader Joe's guacamole to that oily limey green spread. The only things this place has going for it is a friendly waiting staff and good drinks. I'd come back here for their presidente margarita. Their 6 oz serlion was very delicious too. I don't know, just be careful what you order here. It may ruin your night.

I've been here so many times and am pretty disappointed in myself that I haven't gotten around to reviewing this place yet. OK, here we go. 1. Ambiance: You can expect to wait over 20 minutes on busy Friday nights and weekends. Otherwise, we have always been seated quickly. They do have a call-ahead wait list and you are added on the list before you even take a step in the door. I have used this a lot- it works. 2. Customer service: They really have done a great job with their wait staff, they are all incredibly helpful and always smiley. I have had 0 issues with the staff. 3. Food: We typically order either the 2 for $20 OR the Dinner and Drinks for $35. Both are really good deals. The food is consistently good and brought out quickly and hot. We are pretty picky with our food, and this place keeps us coming back. The desserts?! man oh man are they good (all of them!). 4 solid stars for this place, I will continue to be back. Thank you Concord Chili's! :)

I love the 2 for $22 deal and the food was good, but the service was terrible. My family and i waited an hour after we ordered, to finally receive our food. The waitress was very nice and polite though.

While shopping the day before Christmas with my niece who is 10 and my younger brother who is 11 we decided to stop and get something to eat I asked them where they would like to go and they chose chilis which is funny to me because I don't know if we have Chili's in Los Angeles and if so I don't know where they are... (Not really searching as I'm not a fan of chain restaurants) being that I attended high school at Clayton Valley. I am very familiar with this location and have lots of high school memories so I found it very hilarious that they wanted to come here. As kids they consider this fine dining lol  My niece got the grilled cheese with french fries and my little brother got the chicken tenders with french fries and I got the mango salsa tilapia which came with rice and veggies...  Nothing memorable, I cannot recall what I liked about this place as a teenager.

Hadn't been at chiles in about 20 yrs. do I decided to go to the nearest one from my home. I went to this in concord. I was disappointed it was not the cleanest of restaurants floors looked greasy bathroom sloppy. The table that we sat at also felt a little greasy. Food was ok since, since I hadn't eaten all day and looked forward to this day. Won't be visiting this location again

Won't be visiting this chili's again.  Took forever to get two drinks and even longer for our dinner.  Asked waiter why is it taking so long, he had no answer.  Mixed drink was terrible, missing ingredients.

Great food but the price too expensive for the mix & match chicken/salmon. I'm not too happy about the service maybe the bartender needs help to serve water it seems like his by himself and can't really serve everybody.

Seriously people really come here to eat this garbage?  First off staff is very freindly so cant complain about them BUT dirty dirty filthy!  floors, seats & bathrooms appalling and I'm no prima donna! The mini burgers were descent & so were the onion rings. Mac n cheese was filled with jalapeño great for someone who wants that but warn a person who thinks they're just getting mac and cheese.  Enchilada plate NO NO NO!   Frozen banquet meals are better avoid at all cost. Final thoughts. ....  not due to the staff but oh my will never EVER come back.  FYI it's a 1.99 charge to play the table games which you get on your bill at the end. No warning when you tap on the tablet so beware!!

This is my local Chili's so I go here more than any other location and have consistently received better than average service for the chain. The wait at night especially on Friday and Saturdays can be really long but the service has been very consistent and good every time I've been there. This food is well prepared and as good as can be expected from a chain restaurant. They have a decent size bar area with lots of TVs for sports and adult beverages. The parking lot can get very crowded on busy nights and I definitely would not park in the shady motel next doors parking lot. I also suggest joining their rewards program if you go to chilis on a regular basis the email you really good deals and you earn points toward free food.

I lump Chili's in with Applebee's as places I choose to avoid.  I've never had a delicious craveable meal at either spot, and this late-night dinner at Chil's with a friend was no different.  He suggested Chili's because he had a free dessert coupon and was acquainted with their 2 for $20 deal, which is admittedly quite a bargain, so I sucked it up.  Absolutely nothing was accomplished to improve my view of this dismal chain.   My friend was hankering for guacamole so he ordered us the chips & salsa with guac - he was expecting it to be tableside guacamole but it was pre-made.  Salsa was tomato-y and watery with no other distinctive flavor or heat, guacamole had a funky tang to it and was LOADED with sliced tomatoes, and though the chips were warm, they were very thin and glistening with grease.  *sigh*   None of the meal options for the $20 deal were especially tantalizing, so I played it safe with the Crispy Chicken Crispers (yep that's their real and ridiculous name), which the menu said would be served with fries and 3 sauces, and was actually served with fries, corn on the cob and 1 sauce.  While the chicken tenders had a decent flavor, there was an equal amount of batter as chicken.  Fries were fine, nothing special.  Corn on the cob had a weird butter-saturated flavor and withered texture.  And the ramekin of ranch dressing they brought was about 1/3 full.  My friend ordered the chicken & carnitas fajitas, making it "Cadillac style" by adding a side of rice and beans, which never arrived.  When we told our server, she said she would take it off the bill, but offered no explanation or apology.  Overall our server Alyssa was abrupt and inattentive - I always felt like I was irritating her, though we weren't making any special requests of any kind.  Her crappy attitude was returned in her tip.   Finally for the free dessert my friend brought home their Skillet Chocolate Chip Cookie.  We shared it back home, and the cookie tasted very generic, vanilla ice cream was fine, and instead of the promised hot fudge, we got a ramekin of caramel that looked like someone had scraped the contents out of it, there was next to nothing in it.  Lame. So I hate to be a jerk but - eff you Chili's.  You remain consistently mediocre, and low prices aren't enough to solve your crimes against the culinary.  Food is generic, and servers are a-holes.
Had dinner there tonight slow service and as we left our waitress was talking crap about us because we didn't leave a tip she didn't deserve a tip took to long to bring our food

I should mention that the majority of the food here is cooked from processed frozen food because it's a Chile's.  So when I heard the guy next to me ask what the secret spinach dip recipe is to his waiter I laughed. Don't get the taco's here. The shrimp were under cooked and I almost gagged. I'm sure they microwaved them to cook them. It was gross. Maybe the burgers are better? The desserts are delicious though.

hostess was rude. we walked in with a party of 8 & were told the wait was 20-25 mins. Okay that's fine. Then a group of seven gets sat before us and we politely asked if we were next. She then told me the wait would be about 30-35 mins. She asked if we wanted to split up and pretty much eat on the opposite sides of the restaurant... What's the point of coming to eat together if you can't even sit together? so we said no and asked why the other party got sat.  hostess: "THEY called ahead." us: "oh okay well then I guess we'll just leave. thanks for letting us know after we've been sitting here for 25 minutes. we're going to BJs. bye."  We weren't mad about the call ahead because I've worked in food service and I've been in her shoes. It was her attitude and the way she presented the situation. No thanks. We will go where our company is appreciated.

eeeaaaahhh, okay, I guess . . . Chili's operates at a prominent corner in Concord, so it's easy to find.  Large parking lot.  If you're staying at Premier Inn, it's a short walk to get here.  Whether you'd want to eat here is a different story. I can tell you that I've never met anyone chomping at the bit to eat here.  Still, it's been a safe alternative.  When I was thinking of proposing, I brought my girlfriend to Chili's to meet a friend who could tell me if she's good (she was).  Once when my inlaws flew in from Texas, they took the rest of my family to eat here while I was at work.  And most recently, they had a "Chili's Gives Back" night where 15% of our bill went to my daughter's school. What do you get?  Okay food at okay prices.  The two-meals-for-$20 is a good deal indeed.  Fries that are a cut above, but still not like McDonald's.  I had tasty Cajun pasta.  Slightly inattentive wait staff;  the restaurant was only a quarter full, and we still had to wait for six minutes after arriving for someone to even acknowledge that a party of three had arrived.  Bar area in the center of the building. It's not a place I'll avoid, but not a place I'll go out of my way to eat at, so I think three stars will do.  Ho hum.
Why does this place even exist? Loud drunkards, sportsball, & food that maxes out at mediocre. Never mind, I just answered my own question.

Went here last night with a friend. I've got some gift cards to restuarants.  It was kind of loud and crowded last night here, most likely getting ready for Mother's day. I really enjoyed what I had last night, quesadilla explosion salad, my friend also had a chicken dish, his had some spice in it also. The Warriors game was on last night. I really do miss the bandito vegetarian burger, CHILI'S PLEASE BRING BACK THE BANDITO VEGETARIAN BURGER. Thanks!!!!!

I haven't been to chilis in probably two years or so and I went today with my mom and we hadn't eaten all day so we were starved and decided to come here. We ordered the pasta and the flatbread pizza (forgot the full names).  Minus one star for the food being just OK..my pasta was super thick so it was a little too rich for my liking and my moms flatbread pizza wasn't anything special in my opinion.  But plus 4 stars for the amazing service. Our food took a while to come out and the waitress apologized and brought us free chips and salsa.  After we were done she still apologized and also gave us 10$ off our meal with chili money or w/e it was called. AND she offered us a free desert but I declined because I was in a rush to go home but I would have totally loved to have their lava cake!  Sad I didn't get her name but she was awesome. Not sure id come back anytime for the food but I felt I needed to write a review for our server!
Great service by Kyle!  Food and drinks were good as well!  When you have good service food is just as good too!

I am alway a huge fan of rewards programs and when it's combined with FOOD, it's a winning combination.  To be frank, it had been a while since I had been to a Chili's.  My last experience was rather indifferent with very little to have a memorable impression, but that has recently changed.  When did Chili's change up their menu, modernized their check out process and just overall improved their service.  The food was delightfully tasty and we'll balanced.  Don't get me wrong, this is by no means 5 star gourmet cuisine, but it is a solid place to enjoy lunch or dinner.  It's family friendly and the menu has a lot to choose from, such as the light options for those who are health conscious... to the full on carb heaven.  I really enjoyed my self here with my family and I would recommend you try Chili's, and if you haven't been a fan and have not been here in a while... give it a shot.  You might be surprised.

Twice in a row now when I have gone there for lunch, they forgot to bring out our waters. The first time we had to ask the waiter bringing out our food to bring us 2 waters. And then today, the same thing happened, but this time they only brought us 1 water (when there were clearly 2 people sitting there with no drinks). Plus the waiter NEVER came by to see if my friend wanted a refill on her endless soup or salad order. I've always had good experiences when I went for dinner time, maybe its just a lunch hour thing?

Is it company policy to provide bad customer service? I've been to chillis only one other memorable time in Oceanside, Ca and even there I received the same shoddy hospitality. It really is sub par customer service, they just want to make it through their shift and go home. Came in then a couple came in after and mad rushed to check in before us and the hostess said nothing and simply escorted them to their table, we then had to wait an additional 10 minutes. The girl who wrote down my name yelled out my name to let me know a table was ready, the only problem is I was still standing in the same spot right in front of the check in booth, guess I'm not important enough to remember for that long. The waitress was even worse,  possibly the worst waitress I've had in the last decade( Im looking at you HEATHER). She not only didn't pretend to smile but she actually had a frown the entire time she was working, she came by our table a total of 3 times, once to take the order, once to drop off food, and once to drop off the check, please note that we had to CALL her over 2/3 of those times; she never came over to us on on her own. Its not as if she didn't like us tho, she was just a lazy employee, she hardly helped any of the tables around us and pretty much hung out around the register chatting it up ( I have proof Lol).
