Have to give the crew at Concord Ave. Chili's 5 plus stars ....I had ordered online and didn't complete the order, thinking that I did headed down to pick up my order and by the time I got there they were closing down . They informed me that the order had not went through.. .but they were more than happy to take my order even though they were closed .Now that is CUSTOMER SERVICE!!   Kudos to the manager and whole crew you guys ROCK....

This place is filthy.  My shoes were sticking to the floor as we walked in, and not just a little bit...........something big had been spilled.  I went to wash my hands and there wasn't any soap.  I wanted a side salad with thousand island and the waitress said they didn't have any, and this was at midday.  I wont be going there again.

Would give this place no stars Ig I could we ended up walking out and didn't even order food.   The place was absolutely filthy, service counters cluttered with debris along with the water & tea refill pitches, food all over the floor and it wasn't even busy.

The 2 for $20 deal is what brought us here this evening. Though I certainly have not been a huge fan of Chii's over the years, I do find them to have stepped up the plate a bit with not only there recent remodels, though as well as with there food options. I was in splurge mode and I really thought the bacon ranch quasadillas just fancied my temptations. I usually hardly ever find anything appealing on there 2 for 20 deals though, this time I found  a winner.  For drinks, I ordered a Cosmo and my hun ordered a diet coke. The Cosmo was ok.  We of course chose the 2 for 20 thing, which comes with your choice of an appetizer and 2 entrees, within the selection of options to choose from. For the app, we went with the crispy onion and jalapeno strings. I of course, the quesadilla and my hun got the fajitas. Place was quite loud and hectic, definitely typical for a Chili's restaurant. Our server also was quite nice though, a little on the scattered side. She kept forgetting things. The crispy onion strings arrived quickly and my, there was alot! As bad as these little crispy things are for you, man are they good. Cheap but good. Quesadilla and Fajitas then arrived appearing less than impressive. My quesadilla on the other hand despite the sloppy presentation, tasted fantastic!! The combination of all the savory flavors of bacon and ranch sandwiched amongst cheese and a warm, crisp quesadilla certainly satisfied my built up temptation. Hun also as usual enjoyed his fajita's. We also got a free dessert by checking in on Yelp. Which we ended up going with the Cheesecake. It was decent but not great. Although, I love the new remodels that have taken place with all the chili's, I still find the environment too loud and hectic for me to ever want to make it a regular spot. The food is a hit and miss with this time being more of a hit and the service as well, though with this time being more of  a miss.Definitely a standard 3 stars in general.

Very unhappy with this place! They give you the Ziosk unit and say you can play games on it. Our son played games on it, and only later did we find out there's a charge to play games... What a scam!!! Not to mention the food is eh'

My first time here was with my family for my 22nd birthday. We decided to have dinner here. We decided to come here on a Thursday night. The location is kind of in a isloted area and I would have never guessed there would have been a Chili's here if I didn't see it on YELP or if my parents didn't know about it.  Anyway, the parking lot is a decent size, the resturant itself was also a decent size and it looked packed when we walked in but it really wasn't. We were seated within 10 minutes and got service right away. Our waiter was really nice and offered water for drinks to asked then asked us what we would like to drink (alcohol wise if any). I tried the pomagrante tequila drink and personally I am not a huge fan of tequila and this mostly just tasted like tequila which I wasn't a huge fan of. So that was the down side. Other than that I ordered some type of chicken salad (forgot the exact name) and it was REALLY good my favorite! & it was really healthy also. Needless to say had a nice time with my family and dinner wasn't half bad. The drink could have been much better though.  Last thing, this particular locations was a bit on the dirtier side. The floor had crumbs and napkins scattered all over the place, not to mention it was sticky. This needs to be improved. Sticky floors are nasty.
Consistent food and service.  It's been there a long time and sustains their location by remaining consistent with good food and affordable prices.
Worst take out food ever !!!! The Buffalo Chicken Salad was so soggy and disgusting. Thrown immediately into garbage.

My coworkers and I came in for an early happy hour around 3 o'clock and the manager "Masood" refused to allow us to sit at the bar because he would then have to put 2 tables together which would then make it difficult for his wait staff to maneuver around. First of all there were only 8 of us and it was still early enough in the day that this shouldn't have been a problem for the expected happy hour rush. Needless to say,the tables in the bar sat empty the whole time we were there and we had to ASK them to honor the happy hour prices when the manager really should've offered. Very poor customer service from this manager as well as our waiter. The hostess that sat us was very apologetic and seemed a little embarrassed by the situation.

My food tasted like it was all one ingredient in a giant gross bag and they just molded it into a Quesadilla Explosion Salad shape. I want to barf just thinking about it, although I won't because barf tastes pretty much the same as Chilis and I just do not need that in my life right anymore today. Or ever.  They sat us in what I like to call, the "B section" because it's where the subpar waitstaff go to "work." They're lazy, or new or have just been there way too long to do their jobs properly. Our drinks perpetually needed refills, they took forever to bring our order and our waitress had this look on her face that said 'I totally forgot you asked me for something but I just remembered right now when I saw your face but I still don't have that thing you were asking for.' Waiting tables is not hard. It's actually very easy. You just politely walk around in a circle asking people if they need things and refilling drinks. Sure, it's hard when you deal with assholes all day, but it's not *that* hard once you quit, get an office job, realize how hard that is, start liking people again and reflect on it. It's a small little circle that revolves around making sure a group of people (A) have drinks at all times, (B) have food to eat and (C) enjoy your company when you are present. And they have this pay-it-yourself machine where you pay your tab with a touch screen and have no interaction with the waiter at all. And they don't even ask if you would prefer the check at your table, they just assume you care about technology and will figure it out. I was there with my parents. I'm pretty sure I had to walk them through it the first time.  And the children. Oh my god the children. We were seated near three groups of children so loud that their parents had clearly given up even trying to teach them about manners or common courtesy. Why do they do that? Spread them out. They're awful, I don't need to hear them over myself.

So I went to this location last Friday evening and I hate to say this but it was the worst experience I have had at a chili's restaurant. The customer service was horrible, our waitress was so rude. The food came out burned and extremely hot ( I burned my tongue) and when I informed the server about this, her response was "well at least it's not cold." Non of us finished our food and left. The food wasn't up to the standard.
Good service , always a good meal for the price . like that there are plenty of TVs for game watching.

I've been to this chilis so many times with friends. Great customer service and great food. Always end up getting the two for 20. Chocolate Molten cake is always good, and I love their chips and salsa!
Our bartender and server ( Cory) is very helpful and friendly he makes the environment more enjoyable, I love when his here. Thank you for your enthusiasm and excellent customer service

My daughter wanted to come her for her birthday dinner. I was worried since I'm vegan and had bad experiences before with chilis accommodation. Omg. The server said I could do the fajitas with rice and beans and broccoli. It was so awesome! Seriously best fajitas I've had since being vegan. Thank you so much for hooking me up, I will be back when I'm feeling glutinous! Lol. So much love to the staff too.

Good place for something quick to eat. Decent food and prices especially on alcoholic drinks. The waitresses could've checked in on us more the last few times we've been here. Sports bar type restaurant so expect to have to speak loudly while you're here. Beware playing games on those electronic tablets at each table. They will charge you! Our daughter got a hold of one another time we were visiting Chili's and it charged us an extra $5 for various games. Keep out of reach of children! Lol

Been going here for years..... today we decided to try the Nachos. BAD CHOICE. Not worth the money. Only 10-12 chips on the plate with toppings on each chip. Nothing like an order of Nachos should be. We expressed our disappointed but no offer was made to fix it or order something else. Poor customer service on this occasion. Definitely WILL NOT be ordering this again.
If the management can't control the drunk loud mouths in the bar - they should issue noise canceling headphones

I usually dont go to chain restaurants, I chose to go here by default, I got out of the movies and it was the only thing open on the way home. There was inly 8 min til close when we walked in, I definitely did not feel a warm welcome.  I see where the frustration may arise having worked in a bar for 5 yrs, at the same time I chose to work that job and unfortunately it entails days when people walk in right before close and you cant refuse them service. I was that ass**** on that day and it was definitely felt. Like Pac says, all eyes were definitely on me.  The meal was so-so, was definitely thrown together with the quickness and sloppy. It smelled like the bathroom door was left open too when I walked in, that musty smell. Nasty.  My friend went to the ladies room and saw an employee walk out without without washing her hands. Nasty.  I wouldn't go here again...

My husband and I were excited to visit this restaurant on a Friday evening after a long work week. I've worked in customer service for a number of years and the way we were treated was incredibly disappointing.  Our server, HAILEY was condescending and beyond rude. I ordered a buffalo chicken salad. When our food arrived, the salad looked like it had been made hours before being ordered. The lettuce was wilted, the ingredients were slimy and the chicken thrown on top was dry. I tried a bite of the food but, it was disgusting.  I mentioned the poor quality to HAILEY and she treated us like we were stupid. Because of the poor experience with the salad, I requested a burger. While my husband sat waiting patiently, his food got cold. HAILEY finally brought a burger but not condiments.  When we went to check out, we were comped for the burger and had to pay for the salad. I'm not certain the reasoning considering my dissatisfaction with the salad which cost more than the burger. Most alarming, no one bothered to apologize.  I'm not certain why Chili's would want an employee that blatantly hates their job, reflecting it onto others. We will never be visiting a Chili's location again and will be certain to discourage all family, friends, coworkers and clients from going there as well.

Haven't been to Chili's in a good two years, this one was alright. It wasn't too crowded when we went, so I expected nothing more than an average lunch time. Unfortunately, we were a little picky when ordering our Nachos for an appetizer and it took about 20 minutes for it to come out. I was starving and was actually about to get up and leave considering I was watching the table next to us get much bigger appetizers served to them, and all we had had so far is our waters but the manager had come out and hand delivered our appetizer to us, free of charge. It was nice, although an inconvenience. I felt very happy after the manager had told us she had gone and prepared it herself since it seemed to be such a problem. It reminded me of myself and what I would have done when I was working. After that, the visit was pretty smooth; got our food, paid with the tablet-thing on the table, and off we were. Food is good, prices are good, staff is good and overall the place is decent.
Lexie ! Great server !!!  Food always great but your server attitude it's one of the most important ingredients to have a great lunch!!!
Quick stop thru to have a glass of wine.. service was top of the line and the have good wine...

Oldtimer cheeseburger was ordered medium rare, forgot the cheese. It came back overcooked, tasteless, dry and rubbery. I took it home for my dog. Staff didn't seem to care. My friends meal was not much better.

Honestly it went from being 5 stars to 2 . The food is not as good as it ise to be and the last server i had (i really wish i could remember her name) was the MOST disrespectful server iv ever had. I was eating with my friend and her boyfriend we got seperate tags she paid for hers and didnt tip because i said i would so my friends get up to leave and as im signing the bill the server rudely comes up and says "your friend do KNOW that the tip isnt included right"? And i just laughed because I MYSELF am a server and i would NEVER say something like that to a customer, but i was actually going to leave her about a $10 tip untill she came up and said that to me . Im just over all done with this chilis id much rather go to Applebees in walnut creek where they're nice and have good food. I cant lie though that molten cake will be the only thing makeing me go back !

I recently ordered home delivery from Chili's AND ordered for take out just a few nights large because one item on he menu was THAT GOOD!  It was the baby back ribs with the Dr. Pepper bbq sauce.  I only got a half rack that's why I was hankering for more just two days later and had to go in and order it again and was not disappointed. However, you might be wondering why then, I only gave them 3 stars and the answer can be explained by one of their other dishes on the menu.  It's called a Fresh Mex Bowl and comes in different varieties like Cicken or beef and it is sort of a bad imitation of Taco Bell's  Cantina Bowl and a taco salad though it doesn't imitate either one successfully.  I ordered the Pork version and it was described on the menu to sound mouth watering, juicy but let me tell you it was the exact opposite.  I could not even recognize the gray, brown, clay-like mass as succulent pork. The taste was positively abhorrent and disgusting.  Just recalling it refreshes my gag reflex.  The dish also contained a "special corn and rice" concoction I forget their words but it sounded tasty with some kind of unique delicious sounding tart dressing (again the description reminded me of Taco Bell's  rice and corn mixture with a tart cilantro lime dressing that is quite good especially for fast food.  Well, Chili's version was some horrid mess with a gelatinous goo they claimed had some chipotle included.   It looked like the slop You might feed your farm swine if you didn't value it much and it tasted worse than anything I've ever had in my mouth going in or coming out!

Lost and starving! Could not find a decent place to eat anywhere. So, for the 2nd time in my life, I ended up at Chilis. The last time had to of been 25 years ago. There were only 2 of us, so they put us on the smallest table on the planet with a stereo speaker blasting us from above. The table was 18" square with booth seats that were about 3" narrower.  Then they insist on cramming all of this yuppy fad bs on the table which took up half of the table. Some stupid, lcd gimmick to try to make you feel like spending more money than you need to is cool. Then, of course, all of the popup menu specials and condiment racks. I was able to get rid of these.  I ordered the steak fajitas, only because it is really hard to screw them up. My ride ordered the salmon with rice. We also ordered egg roles for appetizer. The egg roles arrived first with ranch sauce for dipping. Excuse me? Ranch on egg roles? This is not a carrot stick. They must be trying to save 3 cents by not giving you actual egg role, orange dip like they did 25 years ago. 25 years ago these were made with fresh ingredients. Now they taste microwaved and mushy inside. Why don't we just call these things pre-turds. They put some funky sauce on the salmon to try to cover up the poor cut of fish. This is the same salmon you see for sale at Safeway for $4.99/pound.  The rice that came with was not worth eating, unless you are homeless, in which case, might seem to be a tasty treat over taco bell garbage scraps.  As for the steak fajitas. What little meat there was was quite tasty. They did not make the mistake of grilling the steak with the veggies, which some places do. That just ruins the meat. The meat was grilled and seasoned well. The included veggies came with an onion butt. You know, the part of the onion that most people throw in the garbage. It also included green, bell peppers. The veggies were clearly over cooked in grease instead of being grilled like a real restaurant would do. As for the service, yup, another limp, wristed, male waitress. I'm sorry, don't these boys have fathers? Males should not be waiting tables, especially this one. They are clumsy and inattentive. This one made a fool of himself by knocking over a woman's plastic mug of water sitting next to us and completely soaking her from being to frantic and clumsy. Only really low quality places serve water in plastic cups. The $45 bill was way over the top for the quality and quantity of food we got. My dog was happy to get the salmon though. Maybe, in another 25 years, if we are lost and starving, we will find another Chillis, and then just keep on looking for somewhere else to eat. I really hate these chain restaurants.

This review is for the delivery service mostly I've been going to Chili's for years I've even work there I have noticed their food selection keeps changing and with every change the food seems more standardized I miss some of their old dishes but I enjoy some of the new as far as the delivery goes every time I order I have to reheat my food not to mention it's very pricey another problem is that app is horrible also they delivered some of the wrong food that's why I'm only getting three stars I would give 4 for going in the restaurant

Came in with my family yesterday. Food was okay, my brothers girlfriends' food was cold. The food that i had ordered off of the kids menu, for my two year old daughter, the plate came burning hot. The waitress tried to put it in front of my daughter but i ended up grabbing it first. Why would you give a two year old a steaming hot plate? Towards the end of our meal the waitress asked if we come here often and we said no, then she said okay, well have a good vacation. Uhm, we never said we were on vacation. We live in concord. We just dont come to that chilis often. Soo you assume were on vacation? Little weird. Overall it was okay.

I used to be a fan of Chili's. Decent/likable food & drink for another corporate chain. But the convenience and likability went straight out the window because of last night's experience. The restaurant was close to empty, yet it took several minutes of awkwardly hovering near the podium to get someone to seat us, despite being in plain view of multiple servers/bartender. Our server seemed nice and I'm sure service would have been fine if the manager (middle-aged brunette female) hadn't stepped in. Had a slight "issue" our server needed help addressing (VALID out of state ID) so he grabbed the manager and she immediately approached the table aggressively and just told us we were wrong. I understand that they're corporate and need to be extra careful with proper ID, but the way the manager handled it was completely unprofessional and inappropriate. Then our server cowardly treated us like the red-headed stepchild the remainder of the evening, hardly checked on us and dropped the check after having only been there for just nearly a half hour (dinner for 4 including drinks, appetizers & entrees). Horrible customer service.  I had the boneless buffalo chicken salad for my entree and woke up this morning vomiting and the like.

Super disappointed. Greeted late, inattentive server, bad food. I liked the payment tablet. Atleast I didn't have to wait for that. Maybe it was an off day, bit if that was my first time there I would have never returned.

I used to frequent Chili's a lot when I lived in the South Bay - there are a few locations down there that are pretty decent, but good lord - the Chili's in Concord is awful. I've placed To Go orders on 3 separate occasions and the last time was the final straw. Put my order in online for a simple meal for one person - easy stuff.  My order was promised at 5:04pm. I arrived at Chili's promptly and there were some other people waiting, no big deal.  When I finally got to the cashier about 10 minutes after arriving, she had an issue with the receipt printer and it wasn't printing my receipt. She seemed totally confused and kept walking away without telling me what was going on.  She then printed out a "receipt" listing my order but with no dollar amount and asked me to sign it.  I'm no moron, so I said "No." - I'm not signing anything without a dollar amount that I agree to!  I ask her if my food is going to be ready any time soon (By this time it was already 5:25pm) and she says "It should be out shortly." So she grabs the only bag sitting on the shelf for To-Go and walks it to a counter in the back.  She finally grabs a manager and the manager comes over to help reprint the receipt.  The manager runs off and I ask her, when she finally returns, "Is there a reason it's almost 5:30pm and my food was promised at 5:04 and still isn't here? I need to speak to the manager."  She seems pissed off now (why? I didn't do anything wrong and she's barely said a word to me about wtf she's doing) and grabs a different person entirely.   I explain the situation and she grabs the very bag of food the chick moved to a shelf in the back.  I ask her if that was my meal and she says "It just came out." to which I respond, "No, it was sitting right there on that shelf when I walked in and the cashier just moved it over there." Needless to say I asked her to void my sale and give me my money back.  I was starving and had already waited almost an hour (we're talking from the moment I put my order in, to the moment it was promised, then another half hour on top of that) and I wasn't going wait another 20 minutes for my food, so I wound up going to Taco Bell. The previous two occasions some similar BS happened so it's safe to say I will never be going to this Chili's again, even though the manager who was very apologetic was damn near pleading me to please come back another time.  Not going to happen!

Cannot beat the Chili, cliché I know! The kids love this place and it is my go to for family dinners when we want to go out and not cook. The staff is always friendly, and even if there are small problems the manager always rectifies it. The manager is new, within the last year and she is super friendly, and always prompt in customer service. The mango tilapia we had this last time was cooked to perfection and the burgers are always tasty. Only reason why I give 4 stars instead of 5 is because the wait can be long and the location is right next door to a crack motel.  Drinks are hit or miss, sometimes they are perfect and sometimes it is all syrup flavoring.

The food was great . The service however was not so great . Im not sure if our server was new or just not properly trained . I always ask the servers what their opinion on the food whats their favorite . We asked him what was better between the salsa or the guac . He said he was not sure that he doesn't really like that type of food . A little disappointed we decided on guac . Then as the food was coming out everyone else at my table had their food but me . Apparently there was a mix up and our server had to ask me what I ordered . Waiting patiently for my food while everyone is is digging in I was getting a bit frustrated . When my food finally arrived I was so excited I reached for the ketchup bottle only to discover that it was EMPTY . At that point I was pretty bummed it took a while to get the waiters attention just for some ketchup . I also realized my meal came with pickles for my bacon burger but there were no pickles on my plate . The server was super polite  just a bit sluggish .

While driving around to decide what my 9 year old and I would have for dinner while she's on spring break we ended up here at Chili's in Concord right by the freeway.  We were sat in a booth right away all the way in the back by the kitchen. My daughter noticed the kiosk that was on the table. It had games and a digital menu on it. We were not introduced to this new system, so by the time my daughter checked it out we had already been charged 99 cents, no approval needed. We took a little while to look over the menu and finally decided to order a large nacho with chicken and a side of guacamole. While we waited the waiter swept under the table next to us which I think is unsanitary. He also brought out 2 platters and a small silver cup. The silver cup contained a teaspoon size of guacamole(I promise I'm not exaggerating). I said what is this? It the guacamole for your nachos. I said you have to be joking for a large nacho you get 1 teaspoon of guacamole. He said yes and apologized and brought another small silver teaspoon cup of guacamole. Then the nachos came with 12 chips front and back with beans in between and a little bit of sour cream and a handful of lettuce. We never received a water refill. I think we were supposed to order it on the kiosk. I'm into technology but this was ridiculous. The food wasn't good and for 11 dollars for a nacho I could have went to the local taqueria. The young man did good so we left a tip but we wont be coming back.

Horrible.  It has been a few years since I went to this specific Chili's and I thought I remembered it as being ok.  It was horrible.  Terrible service - we had to stand up or wave down our server anytime we wanted anything, and we were sitting right next to one of the registers / order machines. Potato Soup was fine.  And the empty potato soup bowls sat on our table for over 30 minutes before our server finally cleared them and we asked for more tea. My friend ordered a cheeseburger and it was LOUSY WITH GREASE.  Greasy lettuce, greasy cheese, greasy buns.  My carnitas 'fajitas' was a pile of greasy shredded pork.  Luckily, they didn't screw up the flour tortillas, as that was pretty much my lunch. We were in the restaurant, ordering off the lunch combo menu (thinking it would be 'quick') for an hour and 15 minutes.  To pay the bill, I literally stood next to the register in order to 'stop' our server and give us some attention so that we could get out of there. I am now just hoping that my 'lunch' will stay down... Stay Away from this restaurant.

Note to self: Never go to Chili's after 5 days juice fasting! Had a craving for Chili's for days. When I got there, I was so freak'n hungry didn't know what to do. We were seated immediately.. No room at the bar.. and was too hungry this time to care. Great.. we got a booth.. Sat down and were handed menus.. I was so confused and overwhelmed by what to order.. I was so hungry, the menu was like a Rubiks Cube. I almost wanted someone to just make a decision for me.  Should I get a Skillet Queso? The Southwestern Eggrolls? Should I just order one of everything?  We were looking at our menus.. then we heard it. A big fatso at a close by booth started barking. Really. I waited and waited for this evening and is the reward I get? A f**ked up night at Chili's? This guy's cough sounded like a seal bark. Cough. Cough. Cough. I was waiting for whatever it was to launch out of his throat. Every few seconds.. Coughing fits. Loud ones mind you. Not quiet. The kind of coughing that is so freak'n disruptive and loud it scares small animals.. After (I kid you not) 20 constant minutes, I'm thinking to myself, "Hurry up and die already."  It disturbed everyone in the restaurant. Literally everyone. I don't know about you, but if I know that I'm going to cough repeatedly, then I will go outside.. Fatso had no common courtesy. Glancing around the restaurant, everyone was getting just pissed. Just when you are about to talk... take a bite... or you think he's finally barked up that piece of steak (the size of a Buick) that he's been hacking on... and you think to yourself, "It's finally over".. Thinking that Fatso has mercifully stopped.. Oh no. BARK. BARK. BARK. I couldn't take it anymore.. It had been going on for 20 minutes.  We all received our entrées and were miserable. So, I started to stand up.. Everyone said, "Don't Andy. Don't." But I couldn't take it. I couldn't!. I started walking over to the choking leviathan and everyone at the restaurant looked at me. They knew what was about to happen.. Then I saw her.. The guy's waitress. As I was walking over to him (to help obviously -wink), She knew what I was about to say.. and looked at me like a deer in headlights.. She looked at me like, "Please, don't. Don't." So, I smiled, sighed, wimping out and turned around and went back.  A few minutes later, she handed him his check and we all literally cheered once he was out the door and as he waddled away. OK. Everyone cheering was either for the game or it was just an awesome crazy coincidence.

Still one of my favorite places! ALWAYS have to start of with the chips, salsa, and Queso dip! Follow that up with a triple dipper or the Cajun Pasta with Chicken and I'm good! Never have had bad service or meal. The bar is a good place to eat and hang out with buddies. Usually here a couple times a month!

Take Out ONLY Review I have been to this location quite a few times (generally for take out) and have never had any issues. Prices are reasonable and the taste of the food is consistent. They always remember to give napkins/utensils and are generous with the condiments. One thing I really like is the fact that you can order online and/or through their app which is incredibly convenient. There is also a special take out entrance and take out parking right in front of that entrance which makes getting in/getting out super easy. One thing that might make it even better is offering curb side pick up so that I don't have to get out of my car. Overall, I am happy with the food and service I receive and will be back. P.S. If you're looking for something to try, my favorite thing are the Southwestern Rolls! Simply delicious!
4 stars for eating in 2 stars for take out  (cold, & bad service) Avg = 3, but I'm no 'rithmatecian

I love Chili's food, especially their queso dip but I absolutely hate this location. We've gone several times and they always get something wrong and someone has to wait an additional 20 min to eat while everyone has their food. But last month we decided never again when I specifically asked for beef enchiladas and they gave me chicken. I specifically told them I couldn't eat chicken because I am allergic and after 1 bite almost had to use my epi-pen because of their mistake. Their response was to give a $20 chili cash and still charged us for the meal. Something my husband didn't realize until after we were home since all he cared about was making sure I was ok. It ruined our evening, almost killed me and all we got was a whoops and stupid coupon. Never go here!!!

Never stepping foot in this piece of shxt Establishment ever again this is the worst example of a restaurant and pleeeease don't get me started on the customer service that is equivalent to a piece of dog shxt stuck 2 the bottom of my shoe no really who has to call a restaurant that they have been waiting to be helped for 7 minutes just to get somebody to come to the front and assist me kiss my axx chilli's... Back to Applebee's bxtches

Man, do I love me some Chili's. The food is consistently delicious (I'm easy to please) and the prices can't be beat. The only downside to this particular Chili's is the size. I know that absolutely nothing can be done about that, but I have encountered too many instances where the bar is too full to sit in. Sad story. And since you can't get happy hour outside of the bar, I book it for Red Robin. Good alternative, but no Southwestern Egg Rolls. Aside from the lack of space, this restaurant is a good choice for a mellow dinner with or without the kids.
Good Place... standard Chili's food. I'd recommend it!

OMG! I ordered a Taco Pizza and it was so nasty and dried out! I asked for mushrooms and jalapeños on it but they weren't even put on the pizza. You can sure bet that they were put on the bill though. My grandsons cheese pizza was burnt around the edges and he didn't want it. We could have done better at Denny's and it would have been cheaper! So unless Chilis is holding a fundraiser for your kids school, I would pick somewhere else to go. What a waste of time and money!

went here this past weekend w/ some friends.. it was not good. I had to reorder a whole different meal because they ran out of rice?!? He wanted to bring me my order with just plain beans and I refused. So I got the ribs w/ sweet potato fries and order came wrong. So had to wait even longer for my dinner. And didnt even discount or nothing for us for all the inconvenience!! Best to try another location! This one sucks.

THESE FIVE STARS GO DIRECTLY TO "LEXIE the server" who actually cared to stop and ask if we had been helped and then offered to bring our drinks, And we were not even her table. But she went out of her way to help us out anyway. This is the way a server should be. Always be attentive to the customers. Our regular server didn't even bother to attend us from the beginning of our experience to the end of it an yet I didn't even know her name since she barely came to check on us. Anyway LEXIE did an AMAZING JOB! My gf wrote a note on the receipt that the five dollar tip was for Lexie and not our original server but she then told us that she couldn't keep it because we weren't her table,  so I then pulled out a five dollar bill and told her "here this is for you because you did a great job". We still left the five dollar tip on the receipt so that our original server has an understanding that even tough she didn't offer us a good experience last night we still were nice enough to give her a tip. And I hope she can treat future guest a lot better.

Great service - Gabrielle was super patient, super attentive without overdoing it, served us promptly with a smile & even helped us dig out of the trash a 4 yr old's first ever birthday card that he'd made for his uncle - He insisted on bringing it into the restaurant. We'd set it aside & then remembered it once we were out to our cars already...She's a saint for understanding the need to dig it out of the trash! & lucky us, we were able to retrieve it... She also worked several other tables with toddlers & infants, all the while being super accommodating, innovative, resourceful & again, cheerful...Thank you, GABRIELLE - we'll be back because of YOU! Here's the story: Went there last week for a birthday lunch for my brother - Yes, he is not into hoity-toity fancy-schmancy places. He's a straight forward kind of guy! It was me, my toddler son, my brother, my brother's best friend & her 2 kids (ages 3 & 4). So, big table - loud, hungry kids getting into everything, you get the picture! Food was great, can't go wrong with: eggrolls, potato skins, buffalo wings, burgers, big bite burgers & fries. My brother also got baby back ribs & salmon - both were great. I ordered some steamed broccoli for my son. It was steamed perfectly. The other boys shared a kids menu quesadilla & apple juices. The kiddos were content with their kid cups & crayons. They drew on their activity book menus so no meltdowns before the food arrived. Timing was great (which you really don't appreciate until you have kids dining with you!), Temps were great, presentation could've been better on the wings, but the kitchen must've missed it (wing sauce drips on the plate weren't wiped away) I am sure the servers aren't plating their own food. None of the plates were too hot to touch (which only happens if you leave them in the window too long!) which, again, is mostly only important for young ones who will touch everything. Drinks refilled frequently & to-go boxes, offered & provided immediately. I may have missed the offer for dessert, but we were all pretty happily stuffed. Checked dropped & processed quickly & it was a successful meal.

Chevys grill was very nice last night. Our sever was awesome and was very mind and patience with. We had a great time. If I had a chance to go back and change anything I really wouldn't even the 11 minute wait was fine while I was cup caking with my girlfriend . Found parking right in the front. Sure 5 stars why not! Food was amazing as well! Food koma.
Didn't know that kids can sit up at the Bar. Just cause you serve food doesn't mean someone under 21 can sit at the Bar. Isn't that why you have Booths and tables for.. This isn't cool at all.
Worst experience ever! The server rushed us to order & food was too over cooked & there was hair in the brownie dessert be careful when ordering not worth 80$ dinner not even the 2 for 20$

My wife and I order drinks from the bar.  The wine was warm and the bourbon and ice was watered down. The appetizer (onion strings and jalapeno) was served cold.  We ordered a big mouth with bacon and chicken with rice and broccoli. The server only came to our table twice.  The meals were served at room temperature.  So was the appetizer. When the waitress did breeze by our table we asked for the manager.  We he came he began to remove our meals from the table before asking what was wrong.  This restaurant has not been the same since the previous manager, Neal, left. My wife and I left immediately and never to return.

Chillies has def gone down hill ever since I worked there in 2009. The food quality has changed but they are not necessarily good changes. Ever single time I go there no matter who I get as a server they suck. And the past few times the food was so nasty. I'm so done with going to chills.

My sons love this place.......for reasons I still cannot understand.  I get these coupons all the time but seems they always are never good on the days we go.  I either miss it by a day or I'm a day early.  These damn people never want to just take care of a customer with the lame...oh we can't do anything for you.  I guess it's not their fault but I'm gonna think twice before going to this over priced olace.....

Terrible- had shrimp tacos they didn't warm the tortillas so they were hard and dry. Then basically put 5 small shrimps in each taco and a ton of cabbage!!! I literally ate the shrimp and left the rest, it was terrible. My mans ribs must have come from a pig dying it starvation cause there was no meat on them. He can eat a lot!!! and left half the rack and his sides. Chillis is decent but this one SUCKS

Chili's has one of the best Lunch Combo menus!! I had the Chicken Enchilada Soup and the Burger Bites; which comes with fries. Every thing was delicious and I only paid $8 with tax!! Best money I ever spent. Will definitely be back for the great food and a Presidente Margarita!!! =)
Very good customer service and delicious food!!! My steak was nice and tender and the mashed potatoes were yum!

I only come here for 1 item the skillet Queso, yea im a chip n dip head.  and this stuff if habit forming..very addictive.  Beers are served real cold. Service is good.  Lots of TV's to catch whatever game or fight is on..will continue to visit and get my queso fix......

I ordered the 2 for 20$ meal and picked the chili lime tilapia, the pork carnitas fajitas, and the chips and guacamole to share. The fish was awesome, sweet and quite a bit spicy. The carnitas was perfectly cooked, and perfect to share with two people (though you'll need to ask for more tortillas and sides). Even the chips and guac were delicious. Everything came out relatively quickly, and the waitress and host were very friendly. I definitely recommend coming here for dinner.

$6, $7, or $8 lunch specials have a soup or salad, fries and a smaller portion entree. AWESOME! I think Chili's will definitely be added into my lunch choices. I was able to eat there and be back to the office in an hour- a must for the working gal.  I also enjoy the 2 for $20 when they offer it- an appetizer and two entrees for $20. The blackberry tea is very sweet, I think I'll be sticking to H2O from now on.

Food was okay.  Had the mix and match ribs, both the dry rub and the barbecue sauced ones.  The cinnamon apples were a little too sweet or at least I felt like I was overdosing on my calorie intake.  The fries were okay though I prefer them a little crispier and basically double fried.  The salad was decent too.

Ate at the chilis in Concord, Ca. over a month ago with my family... Ordered a burger with bacon and sweet potato fries and it was the worst decision I have made in a long time. I was up for the next two days vomiting my brains out with food poisoning due to the poorly handled meat they used. Thanks to your restaurant, I missed my mothers graduation ceremony, a woman who has been taking night classes and raising two kids while maintaining a full time job since I can remember... And I couldn't even be there to see the ceremony. I will not be eating at any Chilis in the future and I encourage oh here to do the same. They have strayed far from the restaurant they once were.

The food was good but the portions are terrible.y sister ordered the fajitas and the sides of cheese and lettuce were puny. She asked for another side of cheese. After all was said and done we looked at the bill and they had charged her for the extra cheese. It would have been fine but the waiter did not say anything about charging extra. Along with that they have these new electronic tablets that you can play around on but again, no sign was around that said you would get charged for using it. I think the waiter should have mentioned to us the extra charges.

Went to Chili's this evening for dinner, and I will never be returning. I ordered the "sizzling" chicken fajitas and was greatly disappointed when they arrived without any sizzle or steam coming from the skillet. The chicken wasn't impressive and the onions and bell peppers were pathetic at best. My dinner companion ordered the chicken fried steak and had to request extra gravy twice, because the first request was met with literally a tablespoon of gravy. The second request was met with enough to make due. The only reason that I gave even a one star rating is because the chicken fried steak was actually flavored nicely and once greeted with some more gravy was acceptable.  The server never approached the table after delivering the second request of gravy until he delivered the bill. The bill did come with what I felt to be the reasonable price of $29. We had placed our money in the tray, two twenties and received back the change of $11 in one dollar bill and two five dollar bills. My dining partner and I each felt it was rather assuming of the waiter that he would be getting a five dollar tip when he didn't really give acceptable service. We normally tip twenty to twenty five percent tip. Lesson learned and Chili's is no longer on our list of restaurants to frequent.

The Southern burger...probably the best burger I've ever had.  Only bad side to this place is the out in the open drug dealing in the parking lot that everyone completely ignores.  Often 6-7 people dealing out of cars or pickup trucks.  I'd think management would call the police but it appears to be a popular spot for this activity.  Makes me kind of nervous walking to and from my car. They should have some sign on the small computer screens on each table saying if you use them you have to pay a .99 fee.  They just add it on the bill without saying anything. Its just the principle.

After numerous failed attempts at finding an open restaurant at 10PM, we came across Chilis and I'm very glad we did.  The reason I gave this restaurant 5 stars is because of their staff. Right when you walk in the door they are very welcoming and seats you right away.  The server we had, Sean was more than accomodating. He assisted us with any question on the menu, asked if this seating was ok, our drinks were always filled, and he had the greatest positive personality and attitude towards us. Especially the time of day it was, he was more than amazing. He even brought us out an extra side plate that we didn't even ask for and in the end we did need it. More servers should take notes from him. I even felt as if we were a hassle asking him so many questions and things to get, but he was more than happy to cater to anything we asked him. Thanks for being a great server.  And not to mention the food was on point. Everything was cooked well, not under or over cooked.

I'm surprised I haven't reviewed this place. I used to go here all the time for lunch when I worked in downtown Concord. I like their soup and salad, it's not bad for the price either.  I came here recently with Derek S. because we felt like taking advantage of their 2 for $20 deal. The parking lot was packed. We sat down in the bar so that we could watch the games that were on. It took a little while for us to get our drink order in and then another 5 minutes to put our order in. That's partly because I wasn't ready and also because our server was pretty busy. We got fried cheese sticks, which were good. Nothing like deep fried cheese as long as they are hot. The marinara was ok. I like their ranch, though. I got the extra crispy chicken crispers. In reference to chicken, they were average. Portion size wasn't really all that. Our corn came out with nothing on it. It's supposed to have butter, salt and pepper. Our server brought us out 2 fresh ones. The french fries were just ok as well. Overall the visit was average. Nothing mind blowing and I guess for $20 it's relative. I won't be rushing back here, but it's a good solid choice for a chain restaurant.

Yeah I like Chili's when I'm in the mood for baby back ribs and a big cocktail menu with pretty pictures of drinks. I felt like the people who worked there DID NOT want to be there though. Pretty sure there was definite sexual harassment happening in the back/kitchen area that was spilling out into the actual dining space/bar in the form of girls giggling while yelling at male employees who were currently laughing at them. And to the bartender who was yelling into the back kitchen so whoever could hear him: it just felt like he was yelling really loud at the people in the bar. Kinda went there for a goodbye thing for a coworker. Pretty bad when our table fell silent multiple times to turn around to watch the employees. Other than that, like all Chili's, our food and drinks came perfectly as we ordered them and in a decent amount of time.

Best place to watch NFL football!  Great happy hours all day Sunday and great bartender (Giovanni aka "G"..aka "Gio").  Super friendly place..reminds me of Cheers... "where everyone knows your name."  This review is for the bar only and only during Happy Hour Sundays!

I really like Chili's but I was a bit disappointed with the Concord location. The service was not that great. I often felt forgotten and ignored. I love the Chili's lighter choices. I highly recommend their Lighter Choice 6 ounce Classic Sirloin its awesome!!  However, I do wish Chili's would document the calories for all their menu items. I usually have to request the information from the server each time.

I've been a fan of Chili's for almost twelve years.  Chili's over Applebee's, Outback or Chevy's without hesitation.  I'm sadden to hear the closing of various locations due to the economic climate.  I really wish they would open one in the East Bay (Pinole, San Pablo, Emeryville) but Concord will due.  I've visited this location a handful of times and every time I can expect: quick service, friendly staff, quality food, reasonable prices, and a good atmosphere. Their menu rotates maybe once a year for variety and new entree additions.  Their signature item is of course their Baby Back Ribs which continues to be a great deal, in my opinion.  For $16 you get a full rack of ribs and two side orders, enough for two people or one big guy.  These rough times have led the company to run a 2 for $20 deal.  Two people can enjoy a appetizer, two entrees, and a desert for just $20. A great deal for the cash strapped student/couple.   Lastly, the service is always top notch with very few flaws for a corporate chain.  The young staff is eager to please as they sweat bullets for their tips and minimum wage.  I appreciate their fast and friendly service and always tip at least 20% but if service is lacking (rarely), I'll tip 15%.  For the decade plus that I've been a patron of Chili's, I've never been truly disappointed. If only other food chains followed likewise, we'd have much better restaurant chains to choose from.

Chilli's is mmm good! My coworker and I were in the mood for something different and she told me about the Chilli's that was around the corner from the office, and how fast and attentive the service is, especially on lunch hour. We both ordered salad's and I checked in using both applications on my phone (yelp, foursquare and got a free - chips and salsa deal) woohoo - what a great treat. Our salad's were delivered shortly after ordering, and were fresh, delicious, and quite a large portion too - gotta love that. I am sure to come back at least once or twice a week!  Great friendly, efficient service, and great quality of food!

FOOD POISONING!!!!!! Went here for lunch with my aunt and I order buffalo chicken wings and a side salad, my aunt ordered their new low calorie Santa Fe salad.  We have been barfing for the last 6 hours.

I love chili's!   I frequently come to this one.  I have always had pretty good service here.  The food is good and the staff is generally nice.  This place is very busy on the weekend and sometimes hard to get a table.
food's decent and full bar, but worst service in restaurant history.  Sat for over 20-30 min before server finally took order.  kept walking around but didn't seem to stop to check on any tables.

Just called to place my order and although the girl was friendly she kept interrupting me and rushing me so i forgot a couple things.. I figured ok maybe they're REALLY busy.. I showed up and the place is nearly empty.. No one said ill be right with you. Two people just saw me waiting at the to go station and ignored me.. Luckily one if the waiters said hi and added my the extra dressing and my drink for free.. That's an employee worth the time I wish I knew his name.. The only thing is, everything is so inconsistant. I always order the same things and sometimes they mistake the honey chipotle crispers for buffalo wings, which is AWEFUL and when you order spinach dip they give you the small one or the big one, even though I always order the big one..
meh..... The service was fantastic and has been every time I go there.  The food has gone down hill.

Bleh! My friend convinced me to go here for their 2 for $20 menu. Being the good friend that I am, I made the extreme sacrifice. And believe me, it was a huge sacrifice. The food here is gross, the service is lacking, and the restaurant could use a good cleaning. I know Chili's isn't exactly known for its amazing food but I have had more than decent meals at their restaurants before. The waiter pretty much disappeared after taking our order and never brought over my drink order (oh well, thank goodness he never charged me for it). My friend who was so insistent on coming here, barely touched her meal. Yeah I guess the 2 for $20 would be a good deal IF you were getting quality food. But why pay that for gross greasy food? Not to mention, I felt so sick after eating here. Take your $20 and go somewhere else!

My boyfriend and I have been here twice over the last few months and have been consistently well taken care of.  We've sat in the bar area both times and have had the same bartender, Shawn, who is awesome.   The chips and salsa fly out of the kitchen so warm and crispy.  The happy hour menu and prices rock!  We will be back!

Chillis is pretty impressive for the price. A group of 12 of us went there last night to celebrate my dad's birthday they were able to accommodate without reservationa. Service was a little slow but our orders were correct, hot and delicious. I got the chicken bacon avocado sandwich and it was the bomb!

Went here on a Tuesday evening and everything was very good. Being on a tight budget we did the 2 for 20 that came with an appetizer and it filled both of us up. Service was great. The only thing is with the fajitas I got, I'm use to having rice and beans with it Also, I'm use to the meat sizzling on a large variety of peppers, onions, ect. The chicken fajitas seemed a little skimpy but everything else was good, hence the 4 stars

Years ago I would go to this Chili's at least every other month. Fast forward to this year and I was surprised by the change in customer service and food quality. My salad had the worst parts of the lettuce and my husband's food was really oily.  We accidentally pushed an app when trying to request service on the computer screen that was conveniently at every table (99cents) Who made the decision that people should have small devices at their local bar and grill while sitting with their friends/family waiting to eat? If I want to play a game I would use my phone instead of communicating with people at my table. Oh, and why keep waiters employed when Chillis  can use the computer as a way for you to request services? Waiters don't need to ask if you would like another drink, you simply let them know by pushing a button! I was not amused by this new way of being. Sorry, I prefer good old fashion service when dining.  Call me old school...

I only have it 4.stars because we had Texas fries and they were super mega dehydrated but other than that my mudslide was out of this world, my tongue is still tingling! The sirloin was tasty and perfect, and the bread crispy on the outside and soft on the issue, seasoned to perfection. Dat mudslide tho, seriously, I've never had a mudslide like it. It was wonderful.
Presidente Margarita is served in a leaking shaker. Fajitas are good and we had a awesome waitress.  Noising kids, that's not the fault of the resturant.

I have been here quite a few times in the past and service and food were always excellent. We came here with a group of friends over the weekend, from the minute we walked in service was slow, server was very unattentive and after an hour wait for our food, it was cold. Next time we will go somewhere different, definitely not here again.

Pricing: Good. Not cheap, but they do have some great lunch or combo deals. Quality: Good. Pretty good, but I am impartial to fusion. Turnaround: Poor-Good. They did not even wait for everyone's food to finish first so why the long wait? Service: Good. Courteous servers came often to refill water and check up on us. The entrees here are not exactly cheap, but they do not break your wallet either. Not to mention, the meals are pretty satisfying here. I did not finish my meal though I did not quite leave enough for another meal. Depending on the different lunch and combo deals, the pricing here is actually super cheap for a large meal. The food is good too though a little on the fusion side so the biased me do not particularly like the food enough to say, "This is some of the best food I ever had!" On that note though, I had the triple dipper with jalapeno burgers, honey chipotle wings, and potato skins. I enjoyed all three items, but the jalapeno burger were just sliders with cut up jalapenos, onions, and tomatoes. The wings were just fried chicken pieces layered in nothing, but a sweet, tangy sauce. The potato skins were crispy and covered in cheese, bacon bits, and green onions, but a tad on the greasy side. The turnaround was ridiculous though. After ordering, we waited and waited until finally the side salad for one my coworkers' lunch combo came and I thought the rest will come shortly afterwards. I went to the bathroom on the other side of the restaurant and came back after my business. Not only was no one served yet, but the coworker still only had her salad in front of her. At least the server kept coming back to refill our water and soda. At one point, she almost made a mistake of mixing the diet coke with a regular coke, but she caught herself, made a joke, and come back with the correct soda.

Forced to the Concord Chilis since our Walnut Creek location is out of business.  This is  - the same as any other chili's. I wasn't thrilled with the service, but that's a variable any time you go out, and they were kind of busy.  They make the buffalo chicken ranch sando as delicious as any other location.

It's a hit or miss on the food. Sometimes it's great sometimes it sucks. Never consistent. Always good service in the bar waiters and waitresses are always polite and fast to bring your order out. I never really sit in the restaurant area so I wouldn't know how the service is there. Good place to go for appetizers and a drink during happy hour but the actual meals never impress. Don't really expect much with the cheap pricing though so it's not too bad.

Last week I went to the chili's in Pittsburg with a friend so were pretty familiar with the happy hour times and menu. Yesterday I was by the mall so I decided to go to the chili's in concord. When we walked in the bar looked pretty crowded so we asked the hostess if we could sit in the dining area and still get the happy hour and the girl said yes. After we were seated and our waiter come to the table my friend asked for a mango presidente margarita's, which she got last Thursday on the happy hour menu and when I asked what other flavors they had he stated strawberry and watermelon. I got the watermelon. Before he brought us our drinks we stopped him to ask him if he could bring out the free chips and salsa as it was 6:45 an happy hour doesn't end until 7. He stated the chips and salsa are only free in the bar for happy hour. I explained to him that i asked the hostess before we even sat down if we could get still get happy hour in the dining area and she said yes. He then asked if the bar was full and I said yes, then he said it was okay. Thennnnn our drinks come out and my drink is not a presidente, which I specifically asked for b/c I know it is on the happy hour menu from last Thursday's experience. The presidente is $5.99 & $0.50 for flavoring such as the mango & strawberry etc. I just let it go b/c I was already irritated. We order, eat & then comes the bill.....  My friends presidente margarita came out to $7.99. We told our waiter that it's on the happy hour menu, therefore it should be $6.50. He stated he was going to talk to his manager and come back to us. When he returned he apologized for not knowing the menu and stated that the presidente is nt on the happy hour menu, even though 4 days ago it was lol. Theire communication w/ one another is extremely off and I don't understand how 1 Chili's has a different happy hour menu than another chili's 20 mins away. What a FUCKING JOKE. I'll never again come to this weak ass flavorless as Chili's again in my life.

I've been here when it's worthy of 3 stars, and when it's worthy of 5, so for now I'll give it 4. Last night I went (the 5 star visit) and there was nothing wrong with our meal. The previous time I had been there (the 3 star visit), food and service were just A-OK. On the 5 star visit the staff was friendly and helpful. The food came out promptly and it was all perfectly done. I got the Big Mouth Bites with a side of loaded mashed potatoes. (If you're going with mashed potatoes, LOADED is the way to go...it comes with real bacon and cheese and chives instead of just a little dab of gravy) My burgers sometimes come out like charcoal, but last night they were juicy and melted in my mouth. Another person in my party got a half-rack of ribs with the standard BBQ sauce. The last time I went out and someone got ribs at Chili's, they were almost inedible, but OHMYGOODNESS these ribs were delicious.  The other person in the group got a Cobb Salad, but said it tasted like any other cobb salad. For desert we got the Paradise Pie. If you want delicious and decadent, get paradise pie. It is a german brownie topped with a big scoop of ice cream. I. was. stuffed. Our waitstaff was quite nice.

I just left Chili's like 10 minutes ago. It was supposed to be a little nice date w/ my husband but the waitress had us sit at the left side. THERE WERE 2 TINY BUGS KEPT FLYING AROUND THE AREA & ONE LANDED ON MY PLATE, I shooed it but it wouldn't fly away and climbed onto my plate and GOT HELLA CLOSER TO MY FOOD which I had to kill it w/ my napkin. I asked the waitress to take my plate away and I told her what happened and EVEN SHOWED HER THE NAPKIN W/ THE DEAD BUG. All she did was, "So, were you done w/ your food?" I was like oh hell no! My husband had to calm me down and not cause a scene. I was mad but didn't wannt to ruin his dinner. The waitress didn't even tell my main waitor about it and when he asked if we had a good dinner, I was flamming! My worst dinner ever! I'll never go to Chili's anymore, they don't have good choice for 2 for $20 anyway.

This place usually is good for a burger and fries.  Been eating here for several years and food is normally good.  Service is always good.  Went to dinner last week with party of six here.  Lets just say one of us had a good meal(the teen with her big mouth bites). its Chili's - average and the best dang milk shakes in the world.

Chilis...the place to be. I gotta admit, this Chilis has never let me down. From their salads to their burgers, the food is "ok" But I have always been impressed with their service here. Well... my friend was in town and since it's the day before my b-day we decide to go get a quick lunch on my lunch break, and a bloody mary of course.  Bloody Mary was delicious... The 2 for $20 menu is alright.  Enjoyed the appetizer (Guacamole and chips) and the service was good but, my ribs were dry.

yumyumyum! we come here for lunch a lot during the week and get the express lunch of soup, salad and chips! It's a very quick, delicious and cheap deal. And the chips are light and refreshing. My recommendation would be to ask to make sure the soup is extra hot because a lot of the times they'll serve it and it'll be luke warm. Servers are always friendly. Thinking about going here for lunch today!

We got a well-intentioned Chili's gift card for Christmas and I was actually dreading going there to use it up. The Chili's I remembered from when the kids were young was greasy, bland, chilly and rude. But, like Chucky Cheese, the kids loved it, and so we went.  What a difference 10 years can make! First, the $7 Top Shelf Margaritas, mine was regular-over, the wife's was strawberry-mango. She was about to send hers back because of the salt on the rim, which turned out to be sugar which she really liked. And I really liked that it made her pleasantly tipsy. After drinking mine (delicious) I felt like I'd just drank 3 beers, it's been awhile since I felt I got my money's worth with a strong drink.  I ordered the chicken/shrimp fajitas, the wife ordered portobello/steak fajitas. Both orders came sizzling hot, everything done to perfection. Along with the chicken, I believe there were 6 jumbo prawns, very tasty, the steak juicy and tender. The beans and rice weren't really needed, but they were only .99 extra and very tasty, both.  I'd knock off a star for 2 reasons, 1) when asking for hot sauce, they came back with Tabasco, which I thought was a little weird for Southwestern-style food, I mean, they could have their own line of Chili's hot sauces, right? and 2) the otherwise delicious, very avocado-y guacamole was over-salted. But I'm putting that star back on there for our server, the best we've had in a long while. Upbeat, friendly, look-you-in-the-eye sincerity, really liking her job.  Nice work, Justine, you go girl.

Chili's is a good place to eat if you really aren't sure what you want. They have a little of everything and the service is usually pretty fast. The chips and salsa are always awesome. Also, the Cajun chicken sandwich is pretty amazing though it's no longer on the menu they will still make it for you. Over all its a good place to eat!

Worst Chili's I've every been to.  I've been to this Chili's several times and the food sucks EVERY time. My favorite dish from Chili's is their Quesadilla Explosion Salad and the salad is all wilty and old, appetizer's are tasteless and lukewarm....  I'm never wasting my money here again.

I was really unsure what excuse to pick for not having to go. come on? first of all I am no big fan of "mexican" food (be it generic, americanized or whatnot) and second of all drinking there??? instead of cheating my way out, I picked my best walmart sweater and left my trailer to head out (actually first we went to the brenden and the walking distance from there is fine). we were seated right away on a weekend night around 9pm while it was pretty crowded. Being a former employee of Brinker, which owns Chilis; it pains me to write another previous employer review. The one I worked at was in San Jose, but I still know the Regional manager.  We went in the other day and had lunch. The Hostess and Server were very nice. We were seated right away and it was not too busy, The only thing is that our Server seemed a little flustered by being double seated. The order was standard and that it was mainly appetizers or quick fried items. We did get our Soups and salads right away, but our Server forgot to "Un-Delay" our Lunch items. The "delay" feature is used as a hold , so that you don't receive your Apps. or Salad/soup and your entree all at the same time. The only problem using that feature, is that if some one else runs out your food; it is easy to forget to "un hold" your order.  The Server realized her mistake and kept apologizing. She made sure were not thirsty and was Quick Draw Mcgraw with refilling our beverages. She did offer to take the Soup/salads off bill and also offer free dessert. Wifey had to get back to work and left as soon as the entrees came out. I know the Server did her best to make up for it, but I was at least expecting an apology or table visit from a Manager. So it took us from 12;30 till 2:13 to eat lunch because of the delay snafu. As I said earlier, the Server did try to make amends for the mistake. The lil' one loved the Shake we received for dessert and the food was alright. We will definite be back.

I loved my visit here. I actually haven't been here in years, and I really enjoyed my last visit. Food is good, place has a friendly atmosphere, family friendly, and the beer on tap is tasty. Only 1 downside preventing a 5 star rating: The amount of people that this place has on weekends. Restroom: clean. Price: reasonable. Summary:  looking forward to the leftovers!  ;)

This place gave me some serious food poisoning a couple years ago that I have not forgotten. Never disappointed with chili's. I like the remodel and  the food at this location was consistantly good like at other locations. Love the fajitas and the margaritas.  Real cool setting.

Damn.  I never thought I would see the day when I gave a Chili's four stars. But I am. Funny how you can have misconceptions about things that can be so utterly far from reality.   For whatever reason, I always assumed that Chili's was a fast food joint.   I'm not sure if it's the name, the logo, or what, but that's an assumption I made a long time ago and I therefore never bothered to go there.   I assumed that Chili's was just another Arby's wannabe.  Thanks, but no thanks... My wife suggested we have lunch at Chili's since we were right across the street.  She being pregnant, the first thing I learned was that she is always right and I am always wrong.  I was happy to acquiesce so we had lunch at Chili's. Holy sliders, Batman!  That was a really yummy lunch actually.   We got 2 sodas with free refills, their Triple Dipper special, and a Fajita Quesadilla Combo, all for $26 tax included.   Katie, our waitress, was charming and friendly and did a great job with service despite that fact that they were totally packed!   And the food, while certainly not slow food, was most certainly above anything you'll find at a fast food joint.  So yeah, I'm a convert... I shattered a misconception today and very happy to have done so.   I will definitely return to Chili's sometime in the future.   Hooray for that!

Several minutes passed and I checked the time, we had been there 20 minutes already and we only had 1 hour for lunch, so I looked around for our server and to my surprise, I saw him cleaning a table and chit chatting with the hostess. I tried to get his attention but was ignored and I watched him go off to another table so at that point we decided to leave.  As we walked out the door, the hostess and the girl she was busy talking to the entire time instead of helping people, watched us as we left without saying a word. We went to Taco Bell down the street, saved ourselves a lot of time and money.  That will most likely be the last time we go to Chili's.
I love this place the fresh food. Nice bar area with lots of TV. The customer service is great. Two for 20 is the best deal.
We went on a saturday night and the food was great.  But the music was too loud.  Not to mention we had a table next to us that made the music seem quiet.

I admit, I love Chilis and I dont know why!! The fajitas are to die for, and the spinach dip is always on point. The chips for the dip are waayyy to salty, and since my hunni is a nurse it's a big no go for him. If you have the taste for chilis, this is it!! If not, probably not the best thing for you!

The food and service have been going down, down, down. Only the host/hostess seemed to be the only ones that want to be there.  If it weren't for their chocolate molten lava cake, we wouldn't be chillin at Chili's no more.
For a chain restaurant they are great for a quick night out when you don't want to cook. Friendly staff and clean setting. I would return!

It's New Year's Day, you're hungover, tired, lazy, & you sure as hell aren't cooking anything for dinner. What are your options in Concord? Not much, unfortunately. Which is why we got Chili's to go.  First of all, they had me on hold for almost 10 minutes. I hung up & called back & they put me on hold for another 4 minutes. OK maybe they were totally swamped since it was New Year's Day. I found out when I went to pick up my food that they weren't swamped at all, there seemed to be as many employees working as there were patrons in the restaurant. Whatever...just give me my food so I can get something in my tummy.  The food was all soggy by the time I got home so it is possible that it would have tasted better if we had eaten it at the restaurant. But somehow I kinda doubt it. The queso dip was watery...I make better queso dip with a can of chili & some cheddar cheese. The chicken ranch sandwich was pretty flavorless. Their fries are decent, I dipped 'em in ranch so they tasted pretty good.  I think I won't be eating at Chili's again unless I'm having the after-drinking munchies where I won't really care what my food tastes like.  Even then I'll be more likely to hit up McDonald's.

loved the burgers and food there but hate seeing drug dealers out there selling drugs when i am parking my car real thrashy people the cops need to patrol the parking lot and run them off feel uneasey going in to the restaurant and coming out but food and serivice is excellent .

I've eaten at this location many times since the late 1980s. My wife and I went last Sunday, when they were absolutely packed with Christmas shoppers. I love this place. They are so friendly and nicer servers guys. and also foods so delicious. I really recommend this place.

We live in Concord but this will be our last time here.  Major police action in the parking lot next to a bad motel, didn't feel safe leaving our car.  Then the salmon my husband ordered was lukewarm and completely undercooked in middle, after a LONG wait.  We had to remind the waiter to bring the salad before dinner.  He never came by to ask how we were doing. My shrimp tacos were a bit warmer than lukewarm, tasted good, but not really great. The waiter said they changed their entire way of cooking at Chili's to accommodate pizzas, which is not why we go to Chili's.  Guess it has ruined their ability to make the rest of the menu! Generally I like Chili's as a chain, but won't be coming back to this one.

Just ate there an hour ago. I eat lunch at Chili's in Pittsburg every other Friday so I know what to expect at Chili's. So we decided to have dinner at the Concord Chili's, big mistake.  We ordered drinks, an appetizer and our meals.  Our drinks came very fast.  We waited a long long time for our appetizer.  Our server finally showed up with our meals and I asked where is my  appetizer.  He said it was coming.  I asked why would I want an appetizer after I've eaten my main meal? I cancelled the appetizer.  The meal itself tasted alright, the problem was it was luke warm not hot, both of our meals were this way, like they had been sitting somewhere forgotten. Not the best dining experience and I will defiantly not recommend going to this Chili's. I'm not going back.  The last time I ate at the Concord Chili's was over 3 years ago and I didn't go back because the service was so poor but at least back then the food was hot. Now they are 2 for 2.
